review: I honestly don't recommend the game because of a few complaints, first of all the game is poorly made, first because of the location, I mean London is a nice place for a movie or something like that, but I'm sure a lot of players didn't enjoy the game because in London you drive on the left. Another thing, because there is no main character, I mean, an ordinary civilian can become the main character with one click, which must have been done with a lot of effort. The third thing, because the physics in the game is somewhat bad, you don't have complete freedom and movement like in wd1 and 2. The story is fine, but because it doesn't have a main character, it destroys it. There are still a few poorly done little things, but they are not so important that I would mention them.

没什么代入感，纯粹的就是逛风景，但是吧，全是大楼，看多了也厌了，感觉比旧金山小多了，电池没了，取而代之的是cd，真的让战斗很难受，前作的互动性很高的东西一个没留，能操作的地方相比前作少了太多，玩了这么久，也不新鲜了。

The first thing I suggest is to run through all of the steps that we have outlined here in our [url=https://ubi.li/4mnuS]Basic PC Troubleshooting[/url] guide. I also recommend that you [url=https://ubi.li/k3cYq]verify your game files[/url] as well as [url=https://ubi.li/096ki]disable your background applications[/url], as sometimes these issues can be caused by a corrupted game file or a background app. One last thing I suggest is ensuring that the game is installed on the same drive as Ubisoft Connect and Steam, if it isn't already. \n\nIf this issue does persist even after giving those steps a try, please reach out to us by opening a ticket on our [url=https://ubi.li/46uzK]Support Website[/url]. When opening that ticket, be sure to include copies of your [url=https://ubi.li/NAnxo] MSINFO and DxDiag[/url] files. This will allow our agents to get a better idea as to what is causing this issue. Thank you!"}

review: 宝可梦是好玩，难道我买正版就是为了连网玩单机，还得被坏档恶心?uplay玩150小时经常连不上服务器，还坏了两个档，一个70小时，一个30小时.steam玩20小时的档人物图标已经错乱了。还有卡汽车、卡建筑，蜘蛛掉出地图的bug，衣服、头发也有时候穿模，优化依托答辩。跟2比删除了很多新颖的玩法，手机也没有了，剧情也一般，看着地图不错实际建筑基本不能进，开车手感也是依托答辩。

review:
Good lord this game is bad, I can't believe this is the same company that made watch dogs 2 and then made this piece of garbage. I am so glad I only paid $20 for this game and DLC. The clunkiest controls for a open world game, the ruined the hacking aspect, progression is so blah and boring. Whats the point of being able to recruit anyone when no-one has anything interesting to add other than oh you can sneak through this area for 10 seconds before getting detected through your disguise, they just feel pointless in the end. This game is so bad I cannot recommend anyone to play this game, go buy watch dogs 2 and play an actual fun and complete game versus this piece of junk.
Edit: 2/21/2023 I have continued to subject myself to another 22 hours of this slog and all I can say is I don't think I am finishing this game, It just isn't fun it genuinely feels like I am playing a worse clunky version of Watch Dogs 1. I hope that if this game ever comes back they need to look back at Watch Dogs 2 that game is a masterpiece with all of its cringey moments compared to this. Once again stay very very very far away from this game!

review: Bought for $30. I regret it. It's like every other Ubisoft game but a little worse. Environment is beautiful. Story, animations, characters, controls, driving physics, progression, and weirdly subdued cyberpunk aesthetic is all pretty awful. Gameplay is repetitive after not even 10 hours of play. Can't believe that want $60 for this in 2023.

review:
It's quite boring. Has a big sandbox in the classic Ubisoft style - that means lots of the same scenarios over and over again in different locations, freeing zones from areas, you know the drill. The main quests weren't very interesting and I didn't get particularly far in before abandoning it to see what the open world had to offer. Turns out, not that much when you get past the initial overwhelming influx of information.

Recruiting anyone and everyone mechanic is awesome at first, gets a bit middling after a couple, then becomes a chore afterwards.

review:
There's a fatal flaw in "you can recruit and play as anyone" kind of gameplay - when you make all the characters so interchangeable you need bad writing. Half of the time the PC responses in conversations barely make any sense, because they are just sound bytes used interchangeably with a dozen others, it breaks any kind of immersion the game builds through the story.

The controls are a pain too, which hack 'q' does seems dependant on some esoteric unknown factor, though usually it ends up being disable every time I want it to be remote control. Esc also changes from opening the game menu to exiting remote control, annoying when you are used to hitting it to pause games, doubly so since there is no easy way to reconnect to your deployed drone or bot already half way through wherever you were sending it.

The story would and could have been good, but their shift from a single player character to everyone's a player character hurts it so much, don't get it unless you can get a great sale.

Update:

I finished the main campaign and started playing the bloodlines expansion, and the problems get worse not better. The one twist in the campaign was good, though they kept jumping around with Cass's motivations in a terrible writing sort of way.

As for the expansion, it dials up a lot of the problems. Actually playing as a single character fixes the writing problems that came from the ability to have any conversation as any character, but the addition of [spoiler]robot enemies that can apparently see and shoot through walls[/spoiler] completely ruins the "play your way" aspect of the game, just lost a mission twice because [spoiler]I sent in my drone, had it start a hacking sequence then hid it out of view but in hacking range, the new robot found me outside the restricted area, through 2 brick walls and started shooting, alerting all the other enemies to where I was hiding[/spoiler]. I prefer to play games like this using stealth, this expansion completely ruined that. The changes to basic spiderbot functions between the two games (not counting upgrades) also forces you into a different playstyle, this expansion wants you to do things guns blazing.

review: 不撞南墙不回头，趁着打着入的。首先我想说的是，如果你在考虑这款游戏，对不起，它真的可以用屎来形容，哦不，可说是连屎都不如。千万别买！听哥的一句劝。玩2~3个小时蹦出4~5个Bug，王尼玛，人传送10次有3次卡墙里还有1~2次人直接掉到地图外面去了。玩你吗，卡Bug还不让换人，只能通过读档重新来？

review:
[h1]65/100 A Half Baked Aight Time[/h1]

WATCH DOGS has been going downhill since one, not in terms of gameplay but in terms of story. I'm not involved in the dumb politics of yet another company trying to launch their own exclusive launcher, so this review will disregard that.

[b][u]GAMEPLAY[/u][/b]

This new entry in the franchise has familiar controls to anyone who has played the series, but offers some new things that make the wild control scheme be a lil bit wilder.

I don't know what the appeal of recruiting almost anyone off the street was, but it is there. It's fine, I guess. Some of the character stories invite some funny roleplay if you are hanging with a goofy group of buds, but overall I don't feel it really adds anything except a slice of roguelike feel. (Each character can start with random perks and weapons, but can ultimately be customized to how you feel.)

The game offers a multiplayer ranked-ish styled open world exploration with a set of missions. To me, all of it felt meaningless. The game was fun running around with friends and getting in to trouble, but the world was unstable as hell. Funny enough, we did stay in sync- which was a problem I ran into with WATCH DOGS 2.

The parkour is fun and a lil janky but you can fiddle with it enough to get it to work. The hacking has been balanced and condensed. The gunplay is mid. The melee attacks have actually been fleshed out to have a sort of complexity to it. Attack, block, and break guard commands.

There is also a legion of the dead (Zombie Mode) which is totally unnecessary but that is where I spent most of my time. It was a lost of fun to run, shoot, hop, grab perks and get points to upgrade my character for the next map. It almost felt like it had a point to it.

Overall, Legion feels like a test of a bunch of mechanics.

[b][u]SOUNDTRACK[/u][/b]

Nothing astounding. Some of the mid-gunfight songs do get a lil bumping.

[b][u]STORY[/u][/b]

Lame. The story is your typical "we're destroying the capitalist machine" left leaning slop. AND THAT'S OKAY but there is literal no substance in any of it. It doesn't really capture you. It just feels edgy, sloppy, and like it was meant to be marketed to weak minds.

There is a single player story and a DLC Aiden and Wrench story that I did not touch, so I can't speak on them.

[b][u]GRAPHICS[/u][/b]

I played this game on low settings and it still looked gorgeous. It was a fantastic visual experience. 

[b][u]SUMMARY[/u][/b]

The game was a great grab on sale. Me and the boys had an amazing time goofing around as the seamless multiplayer was phenomenal. This was definitely not worth full price. The game seemed to have no point, save for explore all these new mechanics in London.

Also I kept driving on the wrong side of the road because of murica.

review:
Do NOT buy unless it's on sale. Steam gets it 2+ years late after greedy Ubisoft finally lets us not be restricted to their terrible platform. But what did they do with those 2 years? Apparently nothing because others have reported bugs, and boy are there bugs. I would say people glitching across the world while driving is just cosmetic but I haven't played the long and have had a crash to desktop and a crash that would not let me change apps or anything else so I had to manually shut down my PC. Guess we shouldn't be surprised as they never polished Watch Dogs 2 either.

If you're a fan of the series then it's okay to buy, just make sure it's on sale. With the extra DLC for a $20 sale price, it's borderline if it's worth that much. Ray tracing looks great but without DLSS, 20-30fps @1440p on a 3080 seems like poor optimization, and 30-50 with DLSS quality.
Es peor en todo con respecto al WD2

review:
J'ai fini le jeu, donc avis mitigé:

Points forts:
- Une grande carte
- Une conduite assez agréable (en tout cas à la manette)
- Graphiquement jolie si vous avez le matos nécessaire
- Un gameplay intéressant, basé sur le piratage, la reconnaissance, des gadgets sympas comme le robot araignée
- On joue pas de personnage principale mais tous les personnages qu'on veut, n'importe qui, n'importe quand, suffit recruter dans la rue.

Points faibles
- Extrêmement mal optimisé (3080ti/1440p difficile de tenir les 60 fps sans RT activé + DLSS)
- Grand map oui mais remplies de collectibles inutiles, chiants, longs, ennuyeux, ultra répétitif
- Histoire principale sympa mais mal exploitée, assez court
- Quêtes secondaires pas fou, manque d'intérêt, répétivité
- Des gros soucis de sons qui buggent en permanence
- Des bugs divers tel des pnj qui se téléportent, des soucis d'animations, des collisions etc...
- Un multijoueur vide...

review:
Watch Dogs: Legion is an enjoyable game with an engaging plot, great graphics, and an outstanding futuristic version of London (super nice for those who know London well). While it can suffer from occasional bugs and repetitive gameplay (a characteristic of Ubisoft games), these issues don't detract from the overall experience.
The main missions have interesting stories, and the game's world is packed with side activities (these are the most repetitive ones). Overall, Watch Dogs: Legion is a solid addition to the series and is worth checking out for fans and newcomers alike.

review:
For its base price it is not worth it. I was lucky. i managed to get the ultimate edition 119.99 for like 90% off at like £27 or something along those lines. but 119,99 thats crazy. At most i would pay £30 as a base price, not a discounted price. And the base game i wouldnt pay more than 9.99 for, not almost 50 bloody euro. the game feels like its not completely finished. I encountered a lot of bugs throughout the game and the world kinda felt really repetitive and boring. I noticed that there were only like 6 or 7 unique recruitment missions and then after that they would just cycle. And everything felt just like go here and hack this and then go there and then watch a cutscene, rince and repeat. The only time i enjoyed the game was near the end. The boss fight was generic at best and easy . Kinda enjoyed it but still generic and easy. I feel that if this game had a few more years of development it would be a major sucess instead of this money grab that it is. 
I am open to criticism of my review and people poking holes into my opinions. Go ahead!

review:
tbh it's not bad, but it isn't good. I wish Steam had a "~" option. For $14, it's a nice time waster. But i don't think i would pay much more than that.

Ubi's best and worst are on display here. There's a really cool mechanic with the "recruit anyone" system, the overlapping schedules and interpersonal relationships... The world design is excellent visually and lore-wise for those who care to dig. Hacking is a bit improved over WD2 i feel, and i like the "tech tree" here. The ever-present AI companion is actually fun, compared to some other robots that refuse to shut up. The clothing options are decently varied and have this wonderful range from 3-piece suit, to cocktail dress, to crop top, to techwear; the games of dressup on offer are wild, and you can dress each of your operatives separately to keep your team varied, or enforce a dress code, since every clothing item (even bras, skirts, piercings, and facial hair) can be put on a male or female character model. I've been playing on Easy with permadeath, and while i haven't lost anyone yet, the shootouts have been pretty intense knowing that if i fuck up, this person i have invested time and money into ain't coming back. The driving is quite good, but i feel like modern sandboxes don't get points for that anymore. Car chases are excellent, and Watch Dogs' trademark hacking, as always, makes it just that much more interesting and dynamic than any other sandbox i've played.

HOWEVER, that's where the praise ends. The game is incredibly CPU thirsty, likely from those overlapping NPC systems, to the point where my framerate is bottlenecking and i can't make full use of my 3080. If i have youtube open on the other monitor like how i play all my other brain-switch-off games, i can't get more than 30-ish fps without making it look like an xbox 360 game. The story is just okay, but because there isn't a protagonist per se, it doesn't really seem to matter. The voice acting is shit, and you'll hear several of your operatives speaking with the same VA, which is jarring for the immersion. I've taken down two of The Big Bads so far and... i don't even really know why. I was told they did bad things but i never really saw them doing it, or noticed a difference in the world after they were disposed of. And then... there are the many many "micro"-transactions up for grabs; cosmetics, upgrades, unique operators with powerful abilities... I know Ubi's been doing that shit for years now but whatever happened to unlocking that kinda stuff? By doing cool challenges or diligently collecting items or... Well. You get it. Also the balance is fucked. There are way too many situations that can be instantly solved with your spider drone or a flying cargo drone, without your operative themself even entering the danger zone. There are other cool gadgets like a stealth field or a sticky emp grenade or the divebomb drone, but why bother when doing it the sneaky way with the spider drone is so much faster and easier? (and less dangerous, if you're playing with permadeath)

The prologue-tutorial is the best part of the game, where 3 or 4 members of Dedsec who know their shit are on a tense, high-stakes mission. They're bantering and bouncing ideas off each other, the gameplay sequence is tight as a walnut, and the voicing is much nicer than the "actual" player characters'. But then, The Inciting Incident happens, and most of them are killed off before the title. It's a very effective setup, but from then on, you play as random civilians who get their missions from a lady on the computer screen. Yeah, OG Dedsec lady doesn't even show up physically, afaik. It feels like... there should have been More.

In the end it's a wide, flat, generally positive experience that's rather pretty and scratches a very specific itch, but it just isn't the kind of game that you'll lose yourself in. If you like Watch Dogs gameplay, you'll love it. If you like story, or characters, or a tense buildup to a satisfying conclusion, this ain't the one.

review:
Пятикратно переваренный калл, потраченного времени жаль. Цитата Гоблина ещё никогда не была так к месту.
Непонятный и нудный сюжет, отвратительная физика и обалденная оптимизация - всё то, что вас ждёт при покупке данного шедевра. Поиграв в FC 5 и AC Origins, я думал хуже быть просто не может, но Ubi не то что пробивают дно, а влетают в него всем своим говноофисом. Не хочется вдаваться в подробности сюжета, изучать механики игры и карту. Всё сделано через одно место. Компания умственно отсталых умудрилась в очередной раз испоганить классную серию игры.

review:
[h1][b]With some major improvements, Overhauls & Complexities. The game would be a really fun Sandbox[/b][/h1]

Played about 20 hours of this game, ON Resistances Mode.

I normally try to do the stealth route. though games were given that this game is a game which says right at the start "We try to avoid fighting at all costs", I try to also avoid combat.

The issue here is Nothing about Stealth works - It doesn't matter trying to sneak into a place because even if you follow the best routes or use an operative with stealth, They throw enemies at you anyway.

The best example of this is the side mission where you need to stop a train. I got a uniformed operative in to stop the train & attempted to avoid the enemies who would spot me, Managed to complete the objective. But bad news! you got a wave of enemies incoming, Oh and if you didn't take down all the ones on site they'll also aggro on you. It literally didn't matter!

(at about 70+ hours) - I was busy trying to do the cab mission. at first I would go in with an operative & like with the other missions as soon as any thing is pulled an army is summoned to Kill you, (2 Shotgunners, 4 captains.) which is really really unfair. because you cannot counter that. Even if you stealth or use a Spider bot the Spawned Guards just know where you are anyway.

That's just one of the many issues. You're a hacker group but the game is treating the world like a combat game. 

The driving doesn't have the same feedback as older games I found myself losing control more often when compared to Watchdogs 2. Enemies would not suddenly spawn in behind me with barely anything to alert me.

The “play as anyone” system is a complex system. Which at its core has similarities to the CTos in-universe. It's an innovative game system however there are a number of things which will improve this system. It's all there but it requires more work.

[b]IMPROVEMENTS[/b]

The game itself feels like it was made by a completely different team, Many fun things to screw with are gone here:

Calling Police or Gangs to fight each other, Or provide a distraction
Apps on a Phone in-game where you could order or track missions
Some customisation options are straight-up gone. (Weapons, Cars etc)
A Paywall preventing total 100%
A Persistent Safehouse.
Traps are largely absent along with seemingly useless wifi connected devices.

As well as glitches:

Scripted NPC events teleporting across the map. (I saw an event in front of me literally teleport before my eyes), Because their event was meant to take place elsewhere but spawn in front of me.
Clipping issues.
Missed matched & Uncanny Voice lines.



If you were to make a Forth & put through 5 years of work without throwing out the project here are some improvements:

[b]Improve the "Play as anyone" system[/b] - I want a system in a similar vein to Shadow of War. There isn't such a thing as a perfect person. Having a set of Strengths with a set of Weaknesses would be cool. Not to mention because of the metadata subsystem. you could see more warnings about who you're hiring. Like they may try to Betray the group.

[b]Overhaul the Stealth systems[/b] - Stealth if done right should be powerful. if I hired a Guard & that Guard was a high-ranking officer I should be able to walk right through the area. Likewise, if I was a Beatcop going through an area with Soldiers I would be suspicious. 
Adding onto that if a Hitman-style system of Enforcers who would look through my uniform would also work.

[b]having Punishment & rewards for play styles.[/b] using stealth through an area I should be able to get in/out with almost nothing happening or if it's an area where guards are called, They'll be more of a technical crew rather than a group of soldiers. Likewise, if you go in guns blazing & kill the soldiers there. You should have Heavies go in for combat. (Honestly, it doesn’t make too much sense having elites called in when it looks as if someone has hi-jacked the system without being noticed)

I will mention now that combat is really easy to do. & the system is okay here (though it's part of a thread of games where you dodge rather than Block) but I’ve noticed that armour doesn’t work. The Database system/"play as anyone" System works but it still isn't perfect. The open world is good to explore.

There is a massive opportunity for Watchdogs.

[h1][b]Expand the systems in this game;[/b][/h1]

--More depth to your cast, Because of the nature of RNG. you don’t know what could happen. I often found myself noticing that Bagley was directing me to recruits. I would like it if you could eavesdrop & hear someone in the crowd speaking about how is best friend is a specialist in something. OR hiring someone who just so happens to know someone who could be a major asset to Dedsec.


--A Risk/Reward system for recruitment, strengths and weaknesses, Hidden risks, potential beef with others etc. 
As an example, you hire an Albion Soldier but even though you get him into the Team he may be a Loyalist to Albion and betray Dedsec. But you won't know that unless you check his meta-data.


--Hidden Skill-trees - Not everyone is a perfect shot, Nor is everyone a perfect recruit. In Rimworld when you click on one of your characters it displays a list of stats (Range, Melee, Crafting Etc). If I was using that in conjunction with other systems. It would lead to a more in-depth experience. 
As well as providing perks & weaknesses based on the graph.

If there was a stealth graph it would be double on a 0 to 10. Anything below a certain number provides Weakness with some overlap with what number will give perks.

--Hitman-style Uniform system - It feels like everyone has a mistrust for everyone else in reality most people would think otherwise. they see a soldier & think "Not my problem".
having a Ranking System for Uniformed Personnel (Police Constable won't question a Police Inspector which won't question a chief Superintendent).


--As you are hiring pretty much anyone off of the street, they’ve been witnessed to be part of Dedsec, they should be a [i]casing mode[/i] like payday 2. Which is all the aspects of normal gameplay until you gain Notoriety. (“Add criminal to Most Wanted”). Likewise, Notoriety should affect characters which have often been used.

I will note that corporate does have differing opinions when it comes to their product. However, I find that depth is way more important than anything else. The systems are there but they need to be innovated upon.

The best way to describe this game:

“A mass-produced building, with New Tech that is missing a lot of features.”

[h2][b]ADDITIONAL: 45 hours[/b][/h2]

Another thing - When you cause an uprising things should become more difficult. when attempting to release the others. 

I've also noticed that when I do complete an uprising it shows on the map that region becoming free, but I also expect there to be something like a news piece to showcase this uprising. as well as a statement on the Albion saying about the uprising. Its more feels like the game going "well done, Here's your free operative." which doesn't feel as good as knowing you're putting the hurt onto your enemies.

review:
I got this game for like, 10 bucks and it still feels like a ripoff. It's everything bad about Ubisoft's game design. It's tiring, its boring, the characters and world are super surface level and basically nothing, and its just, its just hours of nothing. Nothing about this game is gratifying to me.

I wouldn't bother. I thought the whole "legion" concept seemed cool but its literally just randomly generated BS that provides nothing in terms of story or gameplay. It's just annoying and arbitrary, like the rest of the game.

Also, the opening section sucks. I dont know any of the characters, I have no reason to care about any of them, and even after learning a little about them, i STILL dont care because the characters you play are literally just empty husks that are randomly generated. It's all stupid.

I got it for about twenty quid along with the expansions and the original game and for that price, I'd say it's worth it. Fun, wide array of missions, interesting if somewhat predictable storyline, and nice to see some cameos from the expansions.

review:
良い点
近未来の都会の街並みが楽しめる
ほぼ全ての個性的な市民を仲間に出来る
様々な人々が個々人のスケジュール通りに行動していて思想を持った集団で社会が構成されている
スキルに虚弱、突然死、体が不自由をもったキャラを見つけたが高校時代好きだった人に自転車で轢かれたエピゾード持ちだったところ

惜しいところ
成長で得られるスキルと個人固有のスキルが被るときがあるのでその場合は強化されたスキルになるようにしてほしかった
キャンペーンは気にならないがオンラインがクラッシュしやすい
レギオンオブザデッドは制限時間を設定させて欲しかったし、プレイ時に得られたスキルなどを次回プレイ時に生かせるようにしてほしかった。またstate of decay2などのように拠点機能があってゾンビとともに生きていくモードがあってほしかった。

現場作業員とドローンエンジニアなどが使いやすかった
(仲間にした現場作業員の口調が刑事T0mizawaにそっくりだったので服装をそれっぽくしてみると笑えてしょうがなかった)
フーリガンや活動家は3，4人仲間を連れまわせてロールプレイが楽しい
路上ギターや乞食スキルは趣がある

review:
I'm coming back to change my review after giving this one another chance. 

Initially I gave WD:L a poor review. I was a big fan of the first game and enjoyed the second, and I thoroughly enjoyed the prequel DLC that brought back Aiden and Wrench. When I got to the main gameplay, my experience soured when I worked out that things like injury and arrests left my character off limits until a timer decayed. I gave it a downvote and uninstalled. 

I came back to give it another go and I'm glad I did. The map is nice midpoint between the first two - plenty to explore with a variety of areas from densely populated to old English preserved relics. Open parks to futuristic locales where holoscreens and drones dominate every road and intersection.
The approach of having almost every NPC be recruitable is an interesting mechanic, and I'm sure players who like to do fun things will get a lot of it. Go and recruit an army of grannies and dress them however you like. Being a simp/schmuck for the first to, I stuck with Aiden and Wrench for the entire game. 
The story itself is maybe the weakest of all three entries. It doesn't have the drama of the first or the comedy of the second. It's linear, with a scattering of side missions to keep you busy, but if you hop from mission to mission you find that there isn't too much padding between the bigger moments. There are some genuine emotional, heart-tugging parts too which I wont spoil here.

If you're still reading this rambling and you enjoyed the first two, consider giving this a go when it comes on sale. Ubisoft have all but confirmed it's a dead franchise now, but WD:L is still one of their better open world playgrounds, and doesn't demand you to spend 300+ hours running across giant open fields to level up enough to unlock that next story mission. (Talking to you, AC: Valhalla)

review:
Pros:
* Makes children cry over it being "political" (see forums)
* Gets straight into the gameplay without a million tutorials and eagle perches/ctOS towers to synchronize
* You can run around London and beat up Tories and their goons
* Recruiting anyone is fun and there's actually quite a lot of personality here
* Aiden Pearce is a likeable person for a change, not an annoying golem with the charisma of a brick thrown at your face
* No Steam achievements, meaning you're free to enjoy the game, rather than suffer FOMO

Cons:
* Ubisoft Connect
* Did I mention Ubisoft Connect?
* Because it's absolutely Ubisoft Connect
* It's Ubisoft Connect, because it can randomly wipe out your saves in a bug that dates back three+ years
* DLCs don't integrate into the maingame (and you can't use Wrenchelina Jolly in the main campaign smh)

review:
If you enjoyed any of the previous Watch Dogs then you will enjoy this as well. Gameplay is fun, being able to recruit anyone is a really cool idea but i only played with a handful of operatives even though you can have a max of 45.

It is a typical ubisoft game, so there are a variety of missions but you do end up repeating the same type of missions at different locations.

The Bloodline dlc is short but it is pretty good and it is probably better to play it first since it actually takes place before the main campaign.

review:
Great game, very fun. Losing the police when you're an anarchic dumbass like me is very difficult, and frustrating. I felt like it was harder to earn currency than Watch Dogs 2, but with it being quite a while (and me having a ton of cosmetic DLCs for 2) I can't really say, but it felt slow. I will forever hate Ubisoft for forcing us to use their bullshit client and not giving us Steam achievements or anything of the like. Also pulled the predictable "The main antagonist is closer than you think" trope. What a plot twist... Not really. True I expected somebody different but I called it 5 hours into gameplay, knowing nothing.

Ubisoft, none of us on Steam give a shit on what your client gives us. We use Steam for a reason. 

There's a ton of finicky things in the game, like driving on the wrong side of the road (just kidding, it's the UK lol.) or cars spawning or driving within or through each other or just crashing, I saw some NPCs spawn twice, which broke immersion. Oh and falling onto a Cargo Drone from a small height would propel the player off the drone because the drone was too close, making getting down a literal death wish. There's also some parts of the map that you can't get to in person even if it looked possible. 

The NPCs behavior was relatively normal to me, with weird things happening occasionally. 

The upgrade system felt weird, because in order to get new upgrades or skills, you needed to buy them with points. Not an issue there, but it's how you earned these points. And the masks were something I wasn't a fan of either. i liked that unlocking a mask gave me the mask, but i was expecting more of shops to buy masks. Also I there's like 20 stores, and there's like 50 of each spread around the map, but I don't know where the ones I haven't unlocked are since the map doesn't show what shops are in the area when hovering over the store icon. 

There's a lot of things I could nitpick, but they're mostly small things that only bother me for a short period, and I really only gave what I didn't like about the game. Everything not mentioned here I was absolutely fine with.
raw_json:
{"recommendationid": "133203724", "author": {"steamid": "76561198414821247", "num_games_owned": 336, "num_reviews": 99, "playtime_forever": 4324, "playtime_last_two_weeks": 0, "playtime_at_review": 4251, "last_played": 1733217950}, "language": "english", "review": "Great game, very fun. Losing the police when you're an anarchic dumbass like me is very difficult, and frustrating. I felt like it was harder to earn currency than Watch Dogs 2, but with it being quite a while (and me having a ton of cosmetic DLCs for 2) I can't really say, but it felt slow. I will forever hate Ubisoft for forcing us to use their bullshit client and not giving us Steam achievements or anything of the like. Also pulled the predictable "The main antagonist is closer than you think" trope. What a plot twist... Not really. True I expected somebody different but I called it 5 hours into gameplay, knowing nothing.

Ubisoft, none of us on Steam give a shit on what your client gives us. We use Steam for a reason. 

There's a ton of finicky things in the game, like driving on the wrong side of the road (just kidding, it's the UK lol.) or cars spawning or driving within or through each other or just crashing, I saw some NPCs spawn twice, which broke immersion. Oh and falling onto a Cargo Drone from a small height would propel the player off the drone because the drone was too close, making getting down a literal death wish. There's also some parts of the map that you can't get to in person even if it looked possible. 

The NPCs behavior was relatively normal to me, with weird things happening occasionally. 

The upgrade system felt weird, because in order to get new upgrades or skills, you needed to buy them with points. Not an issue there, but it's how you earned these points. And the masks were something I wasn't a fan of either. i liked that unlocking a mask gave me the mask, but i was expecting more of shops to buy masks. Also I there's like 20 stores, and there's like 50 of each spread around the map, but I don't know where the ones I haven't unlocked are since the map doesn't show what shops are in the area when hovering over the store icon.

review: Bonitos gráficos, juego lleno de bugs, denuvo que se nota realmente se hace notar, bastante plano y repetitivo y algo que es lamentable quitaron muchas mecánicas y mejoras que se tenían de juegos anteriores ni siquiera puedes conseguir vehículos para los agentes que no tienen y así llamarlos vehículos en lugar de estar robando, esperaba poder mejorar a los agentes que adquirieran habilidades, por otro lado se da muy poco ETO (la moneda del juego) a comparación de juegos anteriores la cual solo sirve para comprarle ropita a los agentes y pinturitas a los vehículos y armas... algunas muchas bastante costosas por cierto, retomando lo que mas me puede las mejoras de los hacks son muy pocas y la ventana que las muestra es peor que juego de móvil las misiones son muy repetitivas y la IA da risa al final entras como si nada importara derribando a todos por la espalda con una facilidad des motivadora por que ningún enemigo esta cubierto por otro npc enemigo todos están en solitario así que si los derribas nadie se entera, por ultimo la conducción y el gunplay se sentían mejor en la anterior entrega abismal mente mejor. NO LO COMPRES SI NO ESTA EN OFERTA, al final logra entretener pero no esperes mucho mas.

review: Dreadfully boring compared to the previous 2 games. They solved the problem of being unable to write a good protagonist by not writing a protagonist at all.  All the protagonist now is is a bumch of stats. Gameplaywise it's not much better, I spend most of my time on a construction drone in the air, just outside restricted areas, sending in spiderbots to do everything. With the exception of a few scripted battles I rarely even got near enemies.

review: Кто бы что не говорил, но это лучшая игра от юбисофт на сегодняшний день. Лично моё мнение. В начале игры есть главный герой, но его убивают и мы должны восстановить влияние Dedsec в Лондоне, вербуя, кого угодно, чтобы противостоять Альбиону. Красиво нарисованный Лондон и классное авто радио делают игру ещё приятные. Некоторые песни из радио я слушаю каждый день, найдя их в вк. Рекомендую. Вдохновляет.

review:
It has some freedoms other games don't offer, the two big ones being different ways to finish most missions, say sneak around or brute force or cyber tricks, the other being seemingly unlimited main characters, pretty much any NPC can be recruited, they have a fair variety of different talents, and even if you pick some hobo NPC you can use him/her to play most of the game with, or pick 100 NPCs and use 1 each mission. 
Few cons, driving is crap similar to CyberPunk2077. The manufacturers of the game aren't steam friendly per se. 
Quite a few glitches with the auto selection of digital items / people, and how sometimes it works through walls and other times line of sight is needed.

All in all, its either a really good low quality game, or a mediocre AAA game.

review:
在uplay和steam都买了一份黄金版，能让我体验到几乎真实的伦敦旅行我觉得就值一回票价，著名的建筑物尽数还原，画面观感非常棒！dlc也是情怀拉满，玩完还是觉得意犹未尽。
就是这个本体玩着没啥代入感，全员主角的设定很大胆但也非常失败，剧情不错但代入感太差了，可能想学孤岛惊魂以反面角色视角来写但结果却很不令人满意。我是全程拿狗哥和扳手通关的主体，还算有点代入感吧。真的很喜欢看门狗系列，希望不要放弃开发，继续带我到新的城市旅游，希望剧情和玩法还有画面三开花！
——来自小黑盒用户仙人一座的评价

review: A good solid game and fun. I have to admit I was influenced by the Negative comments and reviews for a long while and held off buying,  but I picked up Legions on sale and was happy I did. Legions has introduced a bit of humour, some AC diversion, and you can wander or fly a drone around the streets of "new" London for hours. Gameplay is good, and the use of multiple characters interesting. The missions are well thought out as well as challenging.  I've found it stable on my system and got good frame rates which make it visually pleasing.  Not a masterpiece Ubisoft game, but there is much to do, its fun, and its  entertainment value is worth the sale price.

review:
Disclaimer: I never played any of the other Watch Dog games. That said, I'll be playing them in the future.
I had no trouble running this on my AMD Ryzen 5 1600 Six-Core Processor with 16M RAM, GeForce GTX 1070.
I also got it on sale.

The game plays smooth for me. My only complaint is the loading screens but they have to buffer all of the textures. I'm OK with that.
You play as several people from London, trying to fight as the resistance.  It's a typical Ubisoft title where the missions are reworks of the same handful of ideas.
If you played any of the Far Cry series, you'll know what I mean. I played all of them and loved them. 
I got the game a week or so ago and I've dumped almost 50 hours into the game at the time of writing this review.
If I had to redo the game I'd have more diversity in the players, like stronger strengths and weaknesses. 
I tend to use a few characters and keep the "hitmen" (M&F) for the dirty work when I can't seem to get in any other way.
I enjoyed the hacking, it's fun to play this as a semi sandbox game. The game doesn't force you into making decisions but rather lets you play it open world, or rather London.

All in all I love it. It's my go-to game to relax.

review:
This game is all over the place but somehow endearing at the same time.
The voice acting here is absolutely laughable, in the sense its so bad its good.
Sometimes you may get an old man who sounds like a 15 year old girl robot, whilst i did genuinely chuckle at times it was for all the wrong reasons and really did take you out of the immersion.
The AI was also terrible and it was very easy to just walk around using stealth to take out as many people as possible whilst enemies who were clearly in ear shot wouldn't see me. And the police will literally chase you for 10 seconds before giving up, the streets are also far too empty for London even taking the circumstances into consideration.

The good though did outweigh the bad, the open world was a real selling point for me.
I am a Londoner therefore I am always going to enjoy a game in that location and being able to use a drone to fly over a future dystopian London was a joy.
The concept of recruitment and having a group of people come together and you can be/play as anyone at anytime really is a different concept and something Ubisoft can be commended for.
There is enough variety in each character for me to say this is a good trade off and a breath of fresh air from the normal one character concept and i enjoyed that immensely. I turned the parmadeath function on too so in the middle of a mission running low on health and ammo really did add to the tension as you can grow to care about your character. 

I think this game is a little like marmite in the sense that you either like it or hate it and i'm firmly in the like it camp but don't get it twisted...if you told me you hated it I'm cool with that too.

I have actually played this through already on another gamesite as I got this as a free download after buying some hardware, and whilst it was dirt cheap purchased it from Steam just to play a mission occasionally here and there as I find this fun and enjoyable and that tells you all you need to know. I guess this game is my own guilty pleasure.

review:
Sere breve y conciso
Positivo (+):  La ciudad, replicada y mapeada de manera muy detallada. Es una ciudad hermosa, con edificios emblamaticos, bien diseñados bastante fiel a la ciudad Londinense.
El diseño de interiores y el nivel de detalle de ciertos objetos es excelente. De noche todo esta iluminado, led, neon, cartelería, edificios, autos ,etc. Se ve lindo.
La historia aprueba ,raspando.No viene a cambiar nada, pero esta ok. El juego lo disfruté. Y por eso le doy reseña positiva.

En contra (-):  Misiones repetitivas:infiltración aca y alla, las tecnologías desbloqueables son muy pocas.El reclutamiento de personajes no esta bien logrado.Con tener 4 o 5 personajes alcanza. Sin sentido reclutar mucha más gente. La conducción de vehiculos es espantoso Nivel: Just Cause. Pesa unos hermosos 110 GB, que llegado el momento , es de los primeros archivos grandes que uno quiere liberar espacio.

review:
Have you ever felt like "Ok, they had ONE good idea and they had to build an entire movie/series/game around it"? This is the case with Watch Dogs: Legion.

THE IDEA: The one good idea this game had is explicitly stated: "Play as anyone". In this game, you travel to London as a random member of DedSec, the same group we saw in Watch Dogs 2. In a random populated London, you play as anyone, which means that you can recruit any person from the street, that has is own abilities and perks, and eventually build your own army with operatives.

WHY IT DOESN'T WORK: The idea of "playing as anyone" is interesting but it's just a facade, mostly because it hasn't got the substance beneath it. If playing as anyone meant "play in different ways", that would have some meaning and value, but these two ideas never fit together. You play as anyone but anyone can have a dedsec gun or use the dedsec gadgets which means that all of your operatives play the same way: You can go guns blazing with a hacker or you can hack your way with a melee fighter. You can approach each situation differently, by stealth, hacking or gunning, but we could already do that in Watch Dogs 2 with one character. Also the perks and abilities are unique but useless: What is the point of the perk of "getaway car" when you can steal any car any time?

So the idea is not bad but terribly misunderstood and underused. The story doesn't help either. In order to make dialogue fit ALL of the operatives, it became the most generic and bland dialogue since Greedfall. The operatives have no character, no arch, no emotions, no nothing. The allies you meet are a welcome change but even they fall flat. Who is going to remember 404 or Kate Lau? 

The story is even worse for 2 more reasons: A) Because the game was build around the idea of "play as anyone" and not around a story, the story becomes the same generic "kill 5 bad corporate guys and save London". Literally you go from one bad corporate to the other until all are gone. There is twist but you will see it coming from 10 miles away, because they didn't bother to hide it or build around it. B) The game acknowledges some serious political issues of surveillance, greed, conspiracies and the like, but fails at every time of addressing the philosophy behind it. It's  the same Assassin's Creed "Freedom vs Order" thematic, but without actually discussing anything. Nobody has any motive, or reasons of doing what their doing and the villains are so badly fleshed out, that you can take them seriously. 

So eventually you have a mediocre and forgettable game, that is visually great, plays decent and has some interesting mechanics (like the Watch Dogs 2) but because is build solely one idea and nothing else, eventually ends up being a poor imitation of what the game could be. It's not bad, but it lacks the soul it so desperately needs, the great moments, the deep dialogues and the interesting characters.

The only reason I'm leaving a positive review, despite the fact of being a mediocre game, is because I still believe in the franchise premise and because with proper management and creative vision, Watch Dogs could be one of the best franchises out there. 

Fun fact: I tried to buy this on Ubi store on a sale, but their store wasn't working. So I opened a ticket and after a week of contact, I had no answer. So I bought it on steam and I got to play it AND leave a review about it.

review:
This game is horrible when played on Steam Deck. Turning it on is a major pain in the a**. All because of it's worthless Ubisoft Connect launcher. You can't play it unless you connect to the Internet first. And every time I turn it on, I have to enter all of my credentials despite ticking "remember me" checkbox. Just turning this thing on takes several minutes.
Furthermore there is a constant, huge popup with info that sth is wrong with my driver. Sometimes it can't be even removed so you have to exit the game and repeat the grueling process of turning it on. And all of that while discharging your Steam Deck.
I am greatly dissapointed. Maybe on PC it will be better.
Oh and forget about any stable fps on Steam Deck, above 30 with setting to medium or low and constant fan noise.

review:
If you like to play the same thing over and over again this game is for you...
The missions are always the same, it gets super boring, the story is meh, the bugs... its ubisoft what do you expect... The only fun part is the team feature where you can basically hire ANYONE on the street, the only thing that made me play for sometime.
Would give it a neutral review if possible, but it is more on the negative side sadly :(

review:
Siendo fan de Watch Dogs, jugando el primero con una historia y personaje increíble, hasta el segundo con una jugabilidad única y fluida. Watch dogs Legion se siente como un nerfeo y una decepción para los fans de la saga. Uno de los juegos que siempre he querido probar pensado que iba a ser mejores que los anteriores por ser el más reciente y cuando salio en Steam aproveche esa oferta que estaban dando a bajo precio: ¿El resultado?  La pero decisión que he tomado pero tenia como obligación en pasarme el juego solo porque lo había comprado.

[h1] Historia [/h1]
Watch Dogs Legion no destaca mucho en su historia como en los antecesores, aunque le puede gustar a los nuevos jugadores de la serie. La cosa es que London esta siendo gobernado por personas corruptas y hubo un atentado masivo que mato a muchas victimas inocentes. Aquí es donde nace Dedsec que intentara buscar a los responsables de dicho atentado y liberar a London de estas personas corruptas. Como digo, la historia no esta mal pero no es como la gran cosa e incluso no puedes ni prestarle atención que ya sabes lo que esta pasando. Si te vas directamente a por las misiones principales puedes pasarte el juego en menos de 10 horas. Siendo demasiado corto como para lo que cuesta el juego.

[h1] Jugabilidad [/h1]
El punto fuerte del juego es su jugabilidad, siendo su característica más importante el de jugar con cualquier persona que encuentres en la calle y cuando digo a quien sea es a quien sea: Un artista, un hacker, un policia, incluso a los enemigos para poder infiltrarse en las zonas muy fácilmente. Lo de controlar a cualquier personaje que gustes esta bien; sin embargo, tienes que hacer varias misiones extras para poder reclutarlos y esto es fastidioso porque te desvían de la historia principal o de lo que estabas haciendo. En parte del gameplay podemos infiltrarnos al lugar de muchas maneras como entrando con un disfraz, en sigilo, mediante cámaras o con drones, este ultimo siendo el favorito del juego porque el 75% de las misiones tienes que controlar una araña diminuta o un dron, lo cual no es nada divertido porque es solo seguir adelante e esquivar obstáculos. Ademas, de infiltrarse con un disfraz no sirve de mucho, porque los enemigos pueden igualmente detectarte si te ven, así que no tiene sentido hacerlo disfrazado si al final es más rápido hacerlo en sigilo que disfrazado. Son muchas mecánicas de juegos que hubieran sido mejores si lo hubieran trabajado muy bien.

[h1] Gráficos [/h1]
Los gráficos son excelentes, cumplen los requisitos para su época y es hermoso ver un London futuristico, con muchos carteles por doquier, anuncios publicitarios animados y drones volando por la ciudad como si fuera un nuevo tipo de vehículo. El diseño de los personajes es variado por no es nada del otro mundo, puede que haya un personaje que destaque más que los otros. Pero en si los gráficos están bien aunque siento que no son tan destacables para enfocarse tanto.

[h1] Sonido y Banda Sonora [/h1]
Algunos de los sonidos del juegos son copiados de los anteriores juegos como el hackeo, esto no es malo porque continúan con la formula. El sonido esta bien, puedes escuchar los pasos de tus personajes, el sonido de los vehículos, de los drones, los disparos, etc. En Banda sonora lo único que destaca son los de la radio que tiene varias canciones con licencia de distintos géneros y la penúltima misión que ponen una canción electrónica durante un tiroteo que sinceramente fue el único momento intenso que tuve en el juego. Sinceramente hubiera esperado más en el apartado de la música en otras misiones pero no destacan mucho.

[h1] Personajes [/h1]
Watch Dogs Legion no enfatiza en tener personajes memorables. En los protagonistas el único destacable es Bagley que es una inteligencia artificial sarcástica que nos dará información durante todo el juego, debido a que es sarcástico e intenta ser "Cool" esto puede ser fastidioso para algunas personas. En lo que si le puedo dar es en los villanos que muestran su lado maligno y el motivo por la cual lo están haciendo sus maldades, es el único punto a favor que tengo. y de los personajes que tu reclutas y controlas, no sientes ningún cariño hacia ellos. Todos los personajes que controlas se mueven, escalan, y luchan igual, alguna que otra diferencia pero todos resultan ser casi lo mismo y ninguno es destacable. Por ejemplo, si reclutas a alguien de Albion (uno de los enemigos del juego) este actuara como si no fuera de esa empresa y no estará en los lugares donde estos enemigos se encuentran, es más, sus propios compañeros pensaran que no trabaja para Albion y pueden atacarte incluso si tienes su uniforme, lo cual le quita el realismo y exclusividad al personaje. O que si controlas algún guardia de la realiza, en vez de caminar como los de la guardia real, este que controlas caminara como otro de los cientos de NPCs que hay en la calle. Es una decepción que no hayan aprovechado en esa parte de exclusividad de un personaje.

[h1] Puntos Negativos [/h1]
Este juego tiene tantos puntos negativos que me decepcionaron bastante:
[list]
[*] El doblaje castellano es horrible, en los anteriores juegos se lo tomaban muy en serio el doblaje, en este se lo toman como un chiste y utiliza tantos modismos y frases que dan vergüenza ajena. Tan pronto como escuche a un personaje decir "Soy la polla con cebolla" automáticamente le cambie el idioma.
[*] Los personajes reclutados no son únicos y no inicias una conexión con estos.
[*] Imposibilidad de recoger armas de fuego o una tienda de armas. Esto es malo porque la pistola predeterminada es una pistola eléctrica que hace muy poco daño.
[*] Misiones de reclutamiento repetitivas y aburridas.
[*] El sistema de hackeo trae muy pocas opciones a comparación de los otros títulos.
[*] Parkour Limitado. Se entiende porque son personas comunes, pero por favor, hay zonas que el personaje no puede escalar incluso si solo tiene que subir un pie. El sistema del Parkour era algo que me gusto más en el segundo titulo.
[*] No se puede mejorar las habilidades de los personajes.
[*] No tiene minijuegos como en el primer juego.
[*] No tiene el sistema de multijugador como en el segundo juego.
[*] El juego no tiene Logros en Steam.
[*] Sigo?
[/list]

[h1] BUGS [/h1]
Esta sección es dedicada al montón de Bugs que tiene el juego de Ubisoft, un clásico. y es que el juego tiene bastantes bugs que me sorprenden que después de muchos años no lo hayan corregido y no creo que lo vayan a hacer.
[list]
[*] A veces cuando vas conduciendo, ves NPCs volando por el mapa o teletransportandose.
[*] Puedes poner el Dron araña en lugares donde te sales del mapa.
[*] Cuando cambias de personaje, el personaje esta fuera del mapa o atascado en una estructura.
[*] A veces en las misiones los enemigos se teletransportan hacia donde estas incluso si lo estas haciendo en sigilo.
[*] El juego a veces tiene errores al iniciar y tienes que cerrar el juego en administrador de tareas.
[*] Algunas mascaras hacen que el personaje no tenga cabeza y puedes jugar con un personaje sin cabeza.
[*] En una misión de rescate, el NPC que rescates te seguirá pero tiempo después se quedara pegado en una estructura haciendo que reinicies la misión.
[/list]
Maldita sea BUGISOFT si fueran bugs menores pero es que aquí rompió récords.

[h1] Conclusión [/h1]
De todo lo malo que tiene este juego, al final cumple su objetivo de entretener, es divertido las distintas formas que puedes hacer las misiones y si lo juegas en la dificultad más alta con Muerte decisiva, el juego se convierte en un desafió en donde evitas a toda costa que el personaje se muera. Pero solo recomiendo el juego pero solo si esta a menos de 5$ o si te lo regalan; de lo contrario, te recomiendo mil veces el Watch Dogs 1 y 2 que son más divertidos, con personajes memorables, y un gameplay entretenido.

[b] Calificación 5/10 [/b] "Un titulo que pudo dar más, pero fue desaprovechado por culpa de una compañía que solo piensa en el dinero".

Pero solo recomiendo el juego pero solo si esta a menos de 5$ o si te lo regalan; de lo contrario, te recomiendo mil veces el Watch Dogs 1 y 2 que son más divertidos, con personajes memorables, y un gameplay entretenido.

[b] Calificación 5/10 [/b] "Un titulo que pudo dar más, pero fue desaprovechado por culpa de una compañía que solo piensa en el dinero".", "timestamp_created": 1677271685, "timestamp_updated": 1677271685, "voted_up": false, "votes_up": 46, "votes_funny": 3, "weighted_vote_score": "0.807097434997558594", "comment_count": 1, "steam_purchase": true, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

review: Vague and unfocused sandbox with no real stakes and unclear reason to care about anything. Game crashes frequently on AMD. Autosave places you far away from your objective when you have to restart. Ubisoft Connect bloatware is slow to load. Gimmick of switching characters doesn't have much utility, and it will inevitably stick you with your least useful character randomly.

review:
[h1] Recomendaciones [/h1]
- Jugar en fácil o medio. La IA es igualmente tonta en difícil pero al menos es menos frustrante el escapar de la policia y ordas.

[h1] Pros [/h1]
- Graficamente se ve muy bien.
- Premisa interesante como en las anteriores entregas.
- Doblaje y lenguaje muy bueno.
- Hay mcuhas actividades que hacer en el mundo y perderte en el.
- La recreación del escenario y los gráficos.
- Muchas posibilidades con los diferentes personajes que te propone. Algunos inutiles y otros bastante divertidos. Toda la ciudad puede ser un aliado.

[h1] Contras [/h1]
- La conducción era increíble en el primero, ¿Porqué empeorarla?
- Todas las misiones son bastante repetitivas. Siguen el patron de infiltrarse en algun sitio, hackea algo y huye.
- Te ofrece mucha libertad pero el propio juego no sabe que hacer con ella. Siempre te ofrece lo mismo, todas las misiones se suceden igual.

review:
Kinda preferable, Gameplay is very good and fine but the Story mode is just really fast, game just took around 3-2 days, If you had working schedule probably 1 week and so, I recommend you to buy bloodline DLC first or season DLC then play along with it making the story more longer.

Honorable mentions are the glitches are really fun to be messed with.

review: Просто отвратительная поделка аутиста. Оптимизации нет, запоминающихся персонажей нет, приятного управления персонажем/машиной нет. Тут ничего нет, даже контента чтобы развлечь самого себя. Зато юбисофт так славно упоролась в повесточку, что можно смело заявить, Лондон сталица африки, куда согнали еще и индусов. Количество цветных персонажей, борцов за права лгбтк и прочих современных веяний просто зашкаливающее, что делает игру раем для ненавистников всех перечисленных, так как дубасить мы их будем просто в нереальных количествах. Режим игры с перманентной смертью не делает геймплей вдумчивым, он просто его растягивает, так как пользоваться пауком вы станете чаще. Реально пригодных или приятных для игры персонажей всего несколько, Пирс, Ренч, ассасинша и классы киллер, шпион. НЕ ПОКУПАЙТЕ ЭТОТ КАЛ ГОВНА

review:
ЭТА ИГРА ДЛЯ ВСЕХ, ЕСЛИ ВЫ ЛЮБИТЕ ХАРДКОР, ТО НЕ БЕРИТЕ. Тут даже ребёнок сможет играть.
И так, по сравнению со второй частью, хуетень. Стрельба кривая, особенно легко это понять на Эйден Пирсе. Те, кто хотят узнать какая там стрельба, смотрите геймплей за этого агента. В кратце, у Пирса есть способность на доп урон после перезарядки. и пули в добавок ещё подсвечиваются. Ну, а когда пули видно, видно их полёт, видно и то, что они вообще в левый верхний угол летят, но урон магическим образом засчитывается. хммм. Оружия не так уж и многа. Не всегда можно скомбинировать нужные тебе обилки агента и оружие. Типо за крутого хакера нельзя брать летальную штурмовку. Только не летальные пуколки, да и то не все. 100% можно снарядить 3 дэфолтных шоковых ствола. Дробовик (кои в этой части просто хуета не понятно как работающая), пистолет (рабочая дистанция - 3 метра) и мп 9 (20 патронов, урон ещё ниже чем у пистолета). никаких вам снайперских винтовок, штурмовых винтовок с глушителем, неа. вот вам мп 5, пистолет и шоковый пистолет с глушителем. Из всей троицы, работает только летальный пистолет, он хотя бы в голову шотит. Тонна багов. Персонаж хуй пойми как ходит по неровным поверхностям, причём лесенки тоже считаются. Короче любая поверхность, не считающаяся синонимом к "тротуар". Нажимая Е для взлома щитка, персонаж, если он находится в позе, ну например под углом в 45 градусов перед щитком, зависнет на пару секунд и потом уже резко запустится анимация взлома. Это постоянно, поэтому я к этому уже привык. Однотипность уровней. Однотипность взлома. Нелогичность мира. Типо я поднял бунт во всех районах... Ну и чо бля? Ничего не изменилось. Стоит ли мне говорить, что физика транспорта всё на том же уровне? Тонна багов. Киберпанк стилистика только на обложке. Из плюсов: куча дронов, которые разбавляют геймплей. Они чутка придают киберпанковости в игру. Ну и если вам хочется после работы или школы чутка поиграть в простенькую игру, то легион подойдёт. Без напряга чутка поиграть, учица тут ничему не нужно. Историю можно чутка пропустить, вы ничего не потеряете. Я наиграл 40 часов, почти полностью прокачался, поднял везде бунт и чутка поиграл в сюжет. Без напряга, на чиле. аааа, блятб, забыл. Стоит ли мне х2 говорить, что ПРЕМИАЛЬНЫЕ агенты лучше стандартных? Ни один из агентов, не может устраивать тотальный блэк аут, кроме Пирса. Вселяться в тела других людей, кроме той тёлки с голд издания. И таких приколов дохуя. Ну и погони немного лучше, чем в киберпанке. Тут хотя бы город живой. И ещё обрезали функционал взлома, во второй части можно было натравливать бандюганов на всех подряд, полицию тоже. Тут так нельзя. Хм, забыл упомянуть ебучий аим асист на ПК. У Пирса есть способность на замедленное время после устранение, ну и прицел вам в это время сам наводится на врагов. Пиздец хардкор. Играю на высокой сложности, но оно не чувствуется.

review:
C'est clairement le moins bien de la trilogie et d'assez loin. Il est beau, c'est sa qualité. Le reste c'est 100 heures à faire la MEME mission avec la même mécanique le même puzzle le même momment ou les enemis spawn de partout face à notre gadget unique(il faut sortir de la zone hostile pour en changer). 
Tout ce qui donnait le sentiment de puissance est perdu les enemis ont la même chose en mieux. Ca finit donc en cover dogfight mal fichu. La maniabilité est de surcroit un calvaire tu galère à monter sur ton drone encore plus à en descendre mais une fois sur6 ou 7 tu en tombe: plus de "mur invisible" autour de ce dernier.  De plus tu fais la partie à pied car les véhicules, particulièrement les motos sont des parpaing et que le choix de londre ou ils roulent à droite est insuportable.

review:
I enjoy the core gameplay loop of infiltrating a restricted area and making use of your gadgets, it's just a shame that so much of the fun of Watch Dogs 1 and 2 was just thrown in the trash.

The wide range of special hack powers are just gone, you get one weapon and 1 gadget with a few pseudo-passives.
The radio selection is hot garbage. It all just feels like the same grating white noise.
The voice acting....well it exists I guess. The characters feel like an AI talking to an AI, the emotion ranges from 0% to 5%.
The controls feel so random, why is camera bound to 9? Why are car hacks bound to completely random buttons like spacebar and C?
The only 2 consistent characters in the AI companion and generic emotionless woman suck. There is no T-bone or Clara who have big punchy characters with complex motives, it's like playing with a bunch of plastic toys.
Frame rate is inconsistent and very spiky.
NPCs load in and just fling across the screen which looks so janky.
There's a complete lack of major landmarks which makes the map feel totally empty, the lack of story doesn't draw you back to a location and help you build that mental connection to landmarks.
The game just jumping in with "by the way there's a bomb going off in parliament" feels like they just couldn't figure out a starting point with the lack of fixed characters. 

The game is alright for $20 but jesus christ is it a crime to charge $80.

The game just jumping in with "by the way there's a bomb going off in parliament" feels like they just couldn't figure out a starting point with the lack of fixed characters. 

The game is alright for $20 but jesus christ is it a crime to charge $80.", "timestamp_created": 1677511846, "timestamp_updated": 1677511846, "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 3, "votes_funny": 1, "weighted_vote_score": "0.516163170337677002", "comment_count": 0, "steam_purchase": true, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

review:
C'est plat. Si vous avez aimé Watch_Dogs 2, le volet "Legion" vous fera mourir d'ennui. Le pari de rentre chaque NPC jouable était audacieux, mais on finit par ne pas s'attacher aux personnages que l'on joue. Alors que dans le deuxième volet, ce qui faisait la force de ce jeu était l'histoire profonde et les personnalités de DedSec. 
Les quêtes (missions) sont extrêmement répétitives, lassantes, et peu diversifiées en gameplay.
Au niveau des graphismes, ça passe, ce n'est pas moche, même si je trouve la carte un peu trop chargée en détails et en props.
Plusieurs années d'attente en évitant les spoils pour être déçue de la sorte, c'est vraiment dommage.
Prix au moment de l'achat: 20€
Note globale : 9/20

review:
Incredibly un-fun and frustrating.  The weapons you start out with are literal peashooters, and you can't equip better ones on any character until you make significant progress in the game, the only way to find a character with a lethal weapon is to walk around scanning everyone until you find one with something lethal which becomes very tedious and boring after a while. In many restricted areas there's also drones armed with rockets and machine guns which you can't hack to disable until you've started an uprising in every single borough, and shooting them does barely any damage, they also kill you incredibly quickly which brings me to my next issue: the cool down on being able to play as someone again is incredibly lengthy at times, I had to wait one real life hour just to play as one again. The game suffers immensely by the gimmick of any NPC being playable as well, it makes it so you have no abilities, passives, or unique weapons you can actually get used to. It also means you can't gain any sort of attachment to your characters, as they all have some sob story for a "backstory" and see no development due to the nature of the game. also the fact that the skill tree has been downgraded to some purchasable tech point bullshit is terrible. london is also an incredibly dark place when it isn't the middle of the day, which makes it incredibly hard to see if you're playing at the recommended brightness and gamma levels.

Having microtransactions is a further kick in the teeth. It's a single player game, there's honestly no need for it. Especially when you have the option to pay for characters that are slightly more interesting than the ones you can get for free. The game is already overpriced as is, especially for the edition with DLC or even for the deluxe edition with a who load of nothing in it.

I was a huge fan of watch_dogs until today, but i'll be requesting a refund right after writing this review.

TL;DR Just get watch_dogs 1 and 2 instead, they are infinitely better games.

review:
"Os agentes do deadsec são incógnitas, podem ser qualquer pessoa dentro da cidade de Londres"

*Se aproxima de um npc aleatório*

"Oi, você é do deadsec, né ?"

I understand. You found paradise in EGS. You had a good trade, you made a good living. Tim Sweeney protected you and there were Ubisoft Connect. So you didn't need a friend like Steam. Now you come and you say "Steam players, give me your money." But you don't even ask with respect. You don't offer friendship. You don't even think to suggest us Steam Achievements. You come into our house on the day when the media says that you have financial problems and you ask us to give you money - without Steam Achievements.
......................................................................................................................................................................................................................

Ubisoft's Chris Early spoke out against Valve's PC digital store, Steam, saying its business model is "unrealistic." He added, "It doesn't reflect where the world is today in terms of game distribution."

Welcome back to the realistic current world ubisoft.

Think twice for next upcoming games.

review:
Колись я грав в Watch Dogs на своїй AMD 7970 в 2014-15 роках. Зараз програв десь 35 годин в Watch Dogs: Legion на Geforce 3090. Маю сказати, що Legion досить важка. Моя 3090 видає fps 85-95 на максимальних налаштуваннях при 1440p.

Що стосується геймплею, то мая оцінка 7 з 10 балів. В перщі часи Watch Dogs: Legion затягує, хочеться бігати Лондоном, щось шукати або просто гуляти, виконувати побічні завдання, вербувати нових агентів. Біглі сдається прикольним.

Але після десь 18-20 годин моєї основної кампанії та вільної гри по місту гра почала задовбувати і вже не привертає таку увагу, нажаль. 
--- АІ здаєтсья вже "тупеньким," можна абсолютно всі місіїї проходити за шпіона с пістолетом з глушаком. Лупасити в кулемета теж можна. Або стелз, якщо ще не набридло.
--- Не має вже азарту дослідити якесь місце в Лондоні, бо знаєш, що там за рогом вже нічого не має нового.
--- Місто стає банальним, поліція вже не так турбує, а місії стали прості.
--- Агенти стали звичайними. Лише деякі привертають увагу і іноді хочеться грати за них.
--- Watch Dogs: Legion гра дуже схожа за АІ та духом на інші серії Убі: Far Cry і Assassin. Механіка дуже схожа. Але це природньо.

В цілому, скажу, що я мав задоволення грати ці 35 годин. І, мабуть, спробую пограти в наступну версію Watch Dogs, коли вона вийде.

Я рекумендую цьо гру, особливо тим, хто ще не грав в серію.

review:
To have fun here, you have to realize that the protagonist IS the hacker group, not "your character." They develop skills and "level up" by recruiting differently skilled individuals so the right set of skills can be sent to a situation. Almost every mission has several ways of solving it: Guns blazing, stealth, drones, hacking, etc. Most missions benefit from a combination of them.

The enemies are pretty fun and terrifying. Mary Kelley is over-the-top evil. Nigel Cass can be clearly seen in today's billionaire stock around the world. Without giving it away: the SIRS and Zero Day reveals are pretty good the first time through. The 404 antagonist is one of the most terrifying missions. 

Enjoy the beautiful world, the hilarious Bagley, and experimentation with various ways of play. Look for hidden entrances to places, drone/spiderbot tunnels, and the path less guarded. If you try to play this as an action shooter, you will be disappointed. Even the tutorial on fighting tells you that going after things primarily with gunplay is a bad idea. Other than that, it's FUN.

Needs more content. Needs to remove BattlEye. Needs a soundtrack. But it's damn gorgeous and funny and fun.

review:
What kind of bullꜱhit is this? The game doesn't even launch. After Uplay launches the game, you enter a blank black screen and the game hangs there until you force end the task from task manager.

What is this ꜱhit? lol

Paid scam Ubisoft. -1/10

UPDATE:

The game is now able to launch after some workarounds I've done. But another problem is that there are many random crashes during gameplay, I'd say a couple of times every 2-3 hours. I don't know why, Uplay Connect asks me to send crash reports so I do that.

Comprem na promoção!

review:
ONLY GET THIS GAME IF IT'S ON SALE (80% off)

I'm in the middle with this game. I only enjoyed my playthrough because I only played as Aiden the entire game (you get him if you buy the gold or ultimate edition). I also liked the permadeath feature they added into the game. To me, it adds a little more fun since you'll perma lose anyone you recruit when they die. The dialogue is just wonky especially when you're running around and recruiting people and doing side missions and the story is just ehhhhhh. But if you like mindless fun/gameplay then this will be fine for you.

review:
I had to buy the game again when it got to sale on Steam, because i already had it on Ubisoft, just to do the opositive of the things haters do.

I saw a very cringe person that brought Watch Dogs Legion , and then left bad review and refunded the game. Cringe and quite toxic and illegal if you ask me.
This game is hats off, good quality, good gameplay, very good improvment in player movments, and car, i had a very BAD HORRIBLE DISGUSTING, diving issue with Watch Dogs , Watch dogs 2, was unplayable, Watch dogs Legion, has a huge improvment, driving is more better, it take time to master, but is better. The Story is cool i didn't finished it all on purpose, just to make the gameplay feel more longer.

I see many peoples speaking shit withouth aving more than 5 hours in game, on steam nor ubi, don't.
Peoples saying the Stealth is bad, it is not bad, yes, you are tracked by the cops or npcs, even when you are invisible, and is your fault if it happens is not a game bug. You're just a noob sorry to tell you that.

They have so many cosmetics with in game curenciy, as grind , which is really cool, to not mention main reason i brought that game was for the Formal wear, even to this day sience 2020, im happy for this, and very grateful.
Because of toxic peoples and ungrateful peoples, that never appreciate improvment, and always have to throw stones, they gave up on upgrading the Pass for like 3 years now, is same items, that come back to the pass in loop, hopefuly WDL will get the love it deserve

I saw someone saying "This game is trash is always raining and make me depressed lol" What the heck, do you already do some reasearch of London climate before opening your mouth and have verbal diarreah to show sutpidity, and the worst is peoples took side with that, what?The game is very on point with London weather, and apperance, it looks great, and i will forever keep WDL in my heart. Is the best game from Ubisoft, and forever will be, and mark my words SOON OR LATER, WDL WILL GET THE LOVE IT DESERVE AND THIS WILL HAVE ONLY GOOD REVIEWS.

I had to count on money and tell my self Watch dogs Legion or cyberpunk? Directly i took Watch dogs legion , played 350 hours, loved it at maximum and still love it, after a year i brought Cyberpunk, and was the worst experience ever ,and i can't understand why peoples love such a sandboxish game like Cyberpunk ,and blame the Watch dogs legion, when in Watch dogs legion, you can do and find more fun.

When you go to PVp is a bit tricky if you're against pro players, they can easly kill you or run away.
The COOP, and the open world without PVP, needs a bit of touch from Ubisoft, because is full of Muslims, and Indians that will use to hack cars or drone and hit you with them, or run over you with the car, and you can't escape, but to leave the session because is hard to keep shoot drones, etc.

I still need to buy the session pass and bloodline DLC's and when i will have money i will do it  for sure.

Watch Dogs Legion is a great game, im glad it got to steam, and i wish it was here from before, i will wait for Far Cry 6 to be on steam too, is more easy to have 1 main platform,

Fvck those peoples that copy paste a old ass quote from 1830, where someone that worked for Ubi said "WDL will never come to steam because it doesn't fit the standards" and peoples keep spam it for no fucking reason, is not like there can be new peoples in company to take care of the game, right?

I have all the masks by now, the money are not a problem, and everything you see on the in game store, youcan achive by playing the game, why someone cry about 10$ a outfit , when in some months of playing , you get it without paying , those peoples that missinformate, i hate them.

You get weekly Boxes with loot masks, xp, or green essence, that help you grow your pass, or needs of skills.
You get to experience this game at fully if you ignore haters, and bad reviews, you can try the game your self, and you will apreciate WDL only if you played or touched WD/WD2, and know how bad the driving was here, and how much WDL improved.

The zombie mode i had a different expectation, would've been better if in zombie mode we could find weapons and keep them with us, instead of getting random person with random perks, and kits, i , my self appreciate to use my own avatar not random, so that's why i did not touch zombie mode.

Keep it up Ubisoft and peoples that appreciate what they appreciate and are not sheeps to follow shit reviews, and fake one.

Oh and , let's not forget of peoples that leave bad reveiw because they try to run WDL on  a pc from 1830, yeah i could manage to run this game at 60FPS on a  DDR3Ram, i7 6700 , 960 2Gb, then you can too.

The quality of game is great, the combat is very awesome ,i enjoy to mele more and stealh than to fight with the guns, and that's a huge thing coming from someone like me who always love to go Rage and blow everything,but in WDL Stealth is more fun.

Good luck to peoples who are used to cheese police from GTA V, you can't really get max wanted in WDL without dying, which is really annoying at times, but fun.

I will make some more guides to help peoples play this game, this game deserve love.

KEEP IT UP UBISOFT, WATCH DOGS LEGION WILL BLOWUP, AND GET THE APPRECIATION IT DESERVE FVCK HATERS.

#LoveWatchDogsLegion

MESSAGE FOR STEAM STAFF
Please in near future, when you allow to refund games, make sure you check peoples reviews, to know if they abuse the refund or not.

Buying a game with purpose to leave bad review and refund it, should be illegal, seflish, and untolerable.

review:
Don't even bother without an SSD, very poorly optimized.

EDIT: Don't even bother WITH an SSD either. I moved the game to an SSD, and the lags and FPS drops still occur, not to mention the minutes long loading times. Refunded. This is the worst WD game so far.

review: 主要试了试steamdeck的支持程度，实际体验是可以玩的。并不是完全不兼容，所谓的不兼容和游戏无关是对育碧那个登陆器的不兼容。什么都点不了，还会让你更新显卡驱动，体验下来800p锁30帧全高画质流畅的一批，不过有些文字发虚需要改善。另外这个游戏检测sd的显存有6个多G，而我记得生化危机重制版2检测是5个多G。真是飘忽不定的显存啊。至于游戏更开始，教学还没过等过了再来评价

review:
As a player that had played other 2 games i  can say that Ubisoft are keeping the good work for this game, but i have some remarks about mechanics such as the lack of drone, no silence assaults and shortage of weapons that can be added from tech. 
  This game is my very good experience and I highly recommend

review:
Por ahora no siento que tenga tantos bugs como dicen, la verdad lo compre de oferta porq jugué los anteriores y por ahora no decepcionó.. Se ve bien, pero creo que se necesita una pc de media-alta para disfrutarlo al 100%, si no la tenés, compralo cuando este con descuento, probalo y si no te gusta, o no te lo corre, reembolso y ya.. review: Es hat eine Sehr gute Story Line, eine Fesselnde Open World welche zum Erkunden einlädt, leider aber auch einen Ingame Shop wo man wieder mal Währung kaufen kann für echtes Geld, was wie ich finde in einem Full Price Titel nichts zu suchen hat. Dennoch macht das Spiel großen Spaß. Ich Verliere mich gern für die ein oder andere Stunde in der Stadt und schaue mir die Zahlreichen Möglichkeiten der Interaktion an.

review:
玩過1、2代真心不推薦自由軍團，就...很差。

再塞多少前作角色都不能掩蓋什麼，光是賣情懷就有點..額，還以為操作前作角色會有什麼差別...結果跟其他路人一樣。
說好聽手機操作，只是選單介面而已，我就想邊打架邊聽音樂! 
劇情也是...出戲得要命...誰啊這又是誰啊關我屁事啊??要嘛就主核心角色feat成員就好了啊，完全沒有任何融入劇情的感覺，2代DedSec至少能笑著看他們搞事。
根本..

我要退遊戲了，雖然我才玩該死的1小時。
我喜歡watch dogs，但自由軍團我不行。

啊對明明二代是多位主角，居然連馬可仕都沒出現(最喜歡這角色了說..)，雖然板手很可愛...

review:
不討論劇情部分（肯定是比不上2代，更別說1代），單就針對遊戲運行和探索方向討論。

優點：
1. 嶄新玩法，無主角模式，老實說這種模式很對我胃口，加上看門狗的題材一直很棒，頗能對應到現實，對於一些背後省思值得注意（現實世界的發展感覺慢慢在往看門狗說的世界靠攏，或者說某些地方已經完全符合了）
2. UB在場景建模沒話說，倫敦風景真的很棒。
3. 操作手感上還算可以，不過這部份很主觀。
4. 說自由度高，但是摸清套路後作業感也重....實在沒別的優點了，就湊合這個當優點吧！

缺點：
1. 優化差勁，雖然3070ti不是80、90的頂卡，但是在無光追模式下開高FPS不到30，開低連60都不到太誇張。要知道很多玩家的配置都只是中階，如果遊戲不思優化，什麼都只往高階配備靠攏，玩家流失是必然的結果。
2. BUG層出不窮，短短不到1小時就遇到3個致命性BUG（畫面死當、直接跳出、按鈕失靈），若只是穿模還好，但這種會直接讓遊戲中斷的致命BUG是不能容忍的。
3. 登入伺服器問題。UB伺服器的問題大家都明白，就是永遠都會有問題，先別說進入遊戲還要等那漫長的登錄，光是啟動器就能讓人皺起眉頭，好啦，至少你們啟動器能最小化，有稍微贏2K的啟動器？
4. 服務很差.......UB為了行銷自己平台，對Steam玩家態度大家都看得到。之前新遊戲都改自家平台上架，到後面自打臉又回來Steam，不曉得是惱羞還是什麼，從其他系列的取消成就等問題，都能清楚看到UB的大小眼。

----------

以上，優點四個，缺點四個，但是缺點實在都很致命，倒讚跑不掉。
看門狗系列應該就買到這代了，下一代若UB還是不改進就不會買，刺客也只買到奧德賽，至於FarCry..從第五代後的那啥新天堂就徹底絕望，換湯不換藥，而且劇情越來越糟糕。

這裡要感謝UBISOFT，他們用自己的方式教導大家，要省下荷包去買別家公司更有價值的遊戲。

review:
Most unique Ubisoft game since 2018. Unfortunately, it's uniquely garbage.
They removed dogs and audio player from Watch Dogs 2. Operators and cosmetics sold in a single player game.
The main reasons you might want this game? The season pass
Season pass has WD1 complete (gives on steam as well) and a better campaign than standard.
