review:
Wer meint, das hier wäre eine würdige Fortsetzung der vorigen Teile, der täuscht sich: Es ist in Wahrheit ein knallharter Deckungs-Shooter mit den üblichen, allwissenden Gegnern - nur halt mit dem Unterschied, dass man selbst immer viel zu schwach bewaffnet unterwegs ist.

Falls jemand einschränken möchte: "Ja, dann nutz doch Stealth!", dem möchte ich hier ein Lachen entgegen werfen. Denn nein, das Stealth-System ist Broken AF. Außerdem hat es Ubisoft geschafft, die schon im zweiten Teil nur sehr mäßige Steuerung in diesem Teil nun KOMPLETT ad absurdum kaputt zu entwickeln. 

Aber es wird noch besser: Da das Spiel auch im Singleplayer-Modus einen ERZWUNGENEN Multiplayer-Part drin hat, wird selbstverständlich eine Anti-Cheat-Engine, die im Hintergrund fleißig unzählige, persönliche Daten sammelt und diese dann ins Netz schickt, benötigt. Ohne diese Spyware im Hintergrund läuft das Spiel btw. ebensowenig, wie ohne UPlay - und beides bitte brav mit Adminrechten. Warum? Darum! 

Es ist schon irgendwie ironisch, dass ein Spiel, in dem von einem allesüberwachenden Softwarekonzern gesprochen wird und in dem man gegen diesen kämpft, selbst eine allesüberwachende Wanze ist, gegen die man nur ankommen kann, wenn man die Entwickler NICHT, wie ein braver Kunde, für ihre Arbeit bezahlt, sondern es sich auf illegalem Wege beschafft. DANN bleibt man in der Tat nicht nur von diesen ganzen Spyware-Maßnahmen verschont, die Framerate ist auch noch ERHEBLICH höher, weil der Rechner eben nicht in einer Tour im Hintergrund den Rechner auf links drehen muss.

Wer noch nicht abgeschreckt sein sollte, für den noch das hier: Die Stadt ist zwar ganz nett umgesetzt, aber naturgemäß eng und "klein", die Fahrzeuge sind einfallslos und fahren sich wie Umzugskartons auf Seifenlauge, die Charaktere sind peinlich, die Outfits hässlich, eine der Protagonistinnen so sympathisch wie eine Wurzelbehandlung und die KI, die einen begleitet, ist vom Niveau her am ehesten mit einem vorpubertierenden 13jährigen, der zum ersten Mal 4chan gefunden hat, zu vergleichen.

review:
Für alle die es kurz mögen 5/10

Für alle die es länger mögen hier die Begründung:

Also die Stadt und open World ist schön gestaltet und sieht mal wieder wirklich toll aus.
Ja das war schon das Positive.

Der größte Selling Point ist auch die größte schwäche des Spiels.
Denn man kann jeden NPC zu einer Spielerfigur machen aber und das ist ein sehr großes ABER, es gibt dabei so einige Probleme.
Das erste sind die Perks. Denn jeder NPC kann zwischen keinem und 4 Perks haben, wobei die sehr random verteilt sind. So hatte ich schon eine Oma die besonders gut im Nahkampf war oder einen Jungen Mann der Körperlich fit war und gleichzeitig schlecht gehen konnte und darum nur sehr langsam ist. Man ist ständig am scannen in der Hoffnung das man einen Charakter findet mit einem halbwegs vernünftigen Perk Satz, aber es ist sehr vom Zufall abhängig ob man so einen auch findet und selbst dann heißt es noch nicht das einem das Charaktermodell auch zusagt. Da haben wir nämlich das zweite Problem bis auf Bauarbeiter und Spezialisten (und die Charaktere der teureren Version des Spiels) hab ich noch keinen NPC mit 4 Perks gefunden - alle "normalen" haben maximal 3 Perks. Und Spezialisten sind eine andere Sache denn diese bekommt man jeweils nur ein mal für das befreien eines Bezirks und dann mit passenden Perks, so gibt es einen Geheimagenten, Fluchtfahrer, Drohnen Pro und so weiter, das Problem ist aber auch hier man bekommt die mit einem vollkommen random aussehen also nur weil ein Charakter coole Perks hat heißt das noch nicht das man den auch gerne spielt oder überhaupt spielen will. Dazu kommt das Waffen ebenfalls Perks sind, es gibt Dead Sec Betäubungswaffen die man als Skill freischalten kann die dann für alle Charaktere zugänglich sind, aber richtige Waffen sind eigene Perks und damit sehr umständlich zu bekommen vor allem im Zusammenhang mit anderen Perks.
Das ganze System hätte sehr viel besser gestaltet werden können wenn halt jeder Charakter ohne Perks daher kommen würde und man dann die Perks erlernen könnte oder wenn man zumindest Perks tauschen könnte um sich so die Charaktere zusammenzustellen die man gerne Spielen möchte mit den Fähigkeiten die zum eigenen Spielstil passen, so wie das System aber ist, ist es einfach nur schlecht.

Und grade weil man jeden Charakter spielen kann bringt es ein weiteres Problem mit sich: Die Charaktere haben eins nicht nämlich Charakter, sie sind halt alle vollkommen blank. Wenn man eine Oma spiel die dann die selben Sprüche klopft wie ein Gen Z Charakter passt das überhaupt nicht. Und das ganze bringt ein noch größeres Problem mit sich nämlich Langeweile, es gibt zwar wieder Sachen wie Technikpunkte finden, Bezirke befreien und andere UBI open World Aktivitäten da aber zum beispiel die Puzzel im vergleich zu den beiden Spielen davor noch viel leichter sind gibt es nicht mal dadurch irgendeine form von Spaß.
Es ist sehr schwer sich überhaupt dazu durch zu ringen das Spiel weiter zu spielen weil es einfach keine Motivation dazu gibt. 
Erst mal gehen Stunden dafür drauf erst mal überhaupt ein paar annehmbare Charaktere zu finden (also nicht mal gute mit denen man dann zufrieden ist sondern wirklich welche die halt einigermaßen OK sind) und dann zieht die Story nicht mal so richtig.

Das Spiel hat das typische UBI Problem man hat eine tolle große Open World geschaffen und versucht die dann mit irgendwas zu füllen. Da ist mir der CD Project Red Ansatz lieber nämlich gute Storys zu schreiben und dann eine Welt zu für die Geschichten zu bauen. 

Also Watch Dogs Legion ist tatsächlich noch weniger zu empfehlen als die beiden Spiele zuvor und die waren ganz nett aber auch schon nicht wirklich der Knaller. Also selbst bei nem Rabatt lieber 2 mal überlegen ob das Spiel wirklich was für einen ist und lieber nix erwarten.

review: I enjoy it but it has its ups and downs. Legions has some unique features and is all around a fun game. It has a few of cliches like the drinking bar bit, and typical GTA style game play "done to death". In Legions the drone Betray function is great!, the drone cargo flying is great too pretty good hacking options. Could be more options though like arrest and enemy attack that's missed from WD2. It's harder to distract enemies. The vehicle control is touchier and harder to get use to then WD2 which was great already. The easy online cell phone in game on WD2 was also far easier to manipulate. I played that online WD2 for Hundreds of hours, the hacking virtual hide and seek is awesome and when the cops and online players chase you is amazing!. Love It!! I find the instant online access is missing In the new Legions, the constant bug of a person flying across the screen at street level while in-game and on missions, is frequent and annoying, MUST BE FIXED!!. I don't like that I can't upgrade attributes as easily as before. You can't get another faction to take out an individual anymore as an awesome distraction to the online opponent play. Overall its fun and I do sometimes play it, and I appreciate the effort Ubisoft went through, because it's huge and I'm a huge fan of the company, but I hope they got some HEAVY upgrades coming!!!!

review:
Pros: Map is excellent. A really faithful distilled version of London - as a Londoner I could almost navigate it based on local knowledge alone.

Cons: Everything else. From the irritating "awwwight guv'nor" cockney-on-steroids background dialogue to the ham character acting, with some truly uninspiring gameplay in between. If a character speaks for more than five seconds they are forced to remind us that we are in London, as if that's a wacky enough concept in itself to carry the game. All the mechanics are basically the same as Watchdogs 2, which was a bit repetitive even then. The multi character setup is distracting and just means we've got loads of badly motion captured characters rather than a single decent one. And for such a driving-heavy game, the driving mechanics are every bit as dull and clumsy as the previous game; getting from A to B is a chore, which is surprising given how well built the map is.

It's a real shame that such a beautifully built environment was paired with such mediocre gameplay - this could have, should have been an amazing game, but the mark was missed by miles.

review:
Можно пройти сюжет, но порой игра бывает такой душной, что аж заходить не хочется, однотипные миссии, в том числе связанные с Assassin's Creed серией, в которых нужно выполнить три дополнительных, чтобы потом выполнить основную. Ну и бред, то что сам костюм как предмет кастома забрали потом на следующей неделе и больше его не надеть никак, если нет соответствующего дополнения... 

7/10 Душнил в игре

review:
I'm only 10 hours in, but the graphics are top-notch.  A visually stunning, realistic London.

I've never been there so I can't speak to the sandbox's authenticity, but it feels quite real. However pedestrian and traffic density should not be the same everywhere.  One or two dynamically generated traffic jams and lots of people around tube stations at different times would help with immersion.

Speaking of immersion, I greatly appreciate the options to disable the various HUD elements. 

The only minor bugs I've noticed are some LOD popping and an NPC collision issue (maybe?) where they bounce around awkwardly against scenery before yeeting themselves skyward or vanishing. It's fortunately quite rare. 

I see a lot of negative reviews concerning story. I'm not very far through the campaign yet, but I I quite enjoy the story so far. 

I don't mind that the characters aren't integral to the plot, I quite like using my imagination to give them a backstory.  I can recommend playing with permadeath ON because it actually matters to you that your characters survive.

review:
I have played the watch dogs games for years and nothing for me topped this game. Amazing graphics, A great arsenal of combos, and the fact that ANYONE on the map (that you have recruited) you can play as. And I see I can get it on steam plus like $14 for the deluxe for the sale is perfect. But once i load in.. It's a black screen. i try again for a few and the issue repeats. it fixes itself (somehow) for it to get into the menu and crash. I try again, crashes, again, crashes. and every single time it crashes it would crash next time much quicker and earlier. Most likely bc i'm using laptop but it sucks that i can't enjoy one of my personal all-time best games. Sure there are a lot of bugs, but that is not what i am trying to say. I talk way too much lol

Try this game for yourself and see what you think about it!

review:
Started playing it on my rigg, thought it was like cyberpunk. i loved it! BUT it laggs and craches all the time. i statred witch a rtx3090, so i bought a 4080 still same problem. 30se of smooth fps the a 2sek freez/ lagg. so i bought more RAM 64gig, same problem, so i bought a new ssd and windows 11, same problem. finaly i bought rtx 4090 still laggs, only thing a havent done in a new CP, and i have an ryzen 9 5900x. spent more time trying tofix this game then playing it. and i so badly want it to work. 4000USD and i still cant play this game..

Edit!! heating problem.... Im an idiot!


FU%!!!

Watch Dogs: Legion hat einen interessanten Gameplay, aber die Story ist mit paar Ausnahmen eher langweilig bzw. 0815. Die Missionen sind am Anfang gut, aber später wiederholt sich alles. Nebenmissionen und diverse Nebenbeschäftigungen habe ich nicht gespielt. Für mich persönlich Zeitverschwendung, man kann dadurch paar Skins, Agenten oder sonst was freischalten, aber auf das Gameplay und Hauptstory hat das keine Auswirkungen. Das Openworld ist sehr gut gelungen.

Watch Dogs: Legion has an interesting gameplay, but the story is rather boring or run-of-the-mill with a few exceptions. The missions are good at the beginning, but later everything becomes repetitive. I didn't play side missions and various side jobs. A waste of time for me personally, you can unlock some skins, agents or whatever, but it doesn't affect the gameplay and main story. The open world is very well done.

Watch Dogs: Legion'un ilginç bir oynanışı var ancak hikayesi oldukça sıkıcı ya da birkaç istisna dışında sıradan.Görevler başlarda iyi olsa da sonradan her şey kendini tekrar etmeye başlıyor. Yan görevler ve çeşitli yan işler oynamadım. Şahsen benim için zaman kaybı, bazı görünümlerin, ajanların veya her neyse kilidini açabilirsiniz, ancak bu, oynanışı ve ana hikayeyi etkilemez. Açık dünya çok iyi yapılmış.

review:
Goods:
- Low price, I got this one for 10$
- General gameplay is OK
- Vibe seems OK
- Can play offline.
Bads:
- "Anyone can be a dedsec operative" sounds fun but in the actual gameplay, it's not so good.
- Puzzles: Instead of giving players some thrilling stages of being a bad ass operative, they forced us to play some boring puzzles and minigames, over and over, these are the worst part.
- Not much control over the saved game files.
- If you don't know what to look for in a mission or what kind of people you should recruit, you are going to stuck for a long while, no hints.
- Uniform Access tactics never really work. Despise the good advertisement.
- No gun modding, no damage upgrade.
- Can't switch operative/gadgets during mission. Pick the wrong one and you are screwed.
- Gun crosshair "slipped" from target when leaning out to shoot, this is a bit annoying.
- Co-op games has not much to do, same mission over and over, 
if the teammate gets killed, mission resets, no reward, wasted your time.
If the mission completed, you get nothing but a small amount of ETO to buy some outdated clothes.
- There are too many unfun restrictions, such as a player character is a wimp with a pistol that deals little damage and the game forced you to kill a swarm of drones to complete the mission. 
In MGSV there are more options to help you complete the hard part, but this game has none.

- There are too many unfun restrictions, such as a player character is a wimp with a pistol that deals little damage and the game forced you to kill a swarm of drones to complete the mission. 
In MGSV there are more options to help you complete the hard part, but this game has none.

review: Eu sou um pai de 45 anos, provavelmente uma das pessoas mais velhas a jogar este jogo. Sou pai solteiro criando meu filho, que agora tem 14 anos. Meu filho ganhou este jogo de seu tio, então o instalamos em seu computador e ele começou a jogar. Até o final da semana ele tinha 24 horas neste jogo. Isso foi horrível para mim, pois já era difícil encontrar maneiras de passar o tempo com meu filho, pois ele está sempre com os amigos ou apenas assistindo ao YouTube. Então eu decidi fazer uma conta no Steam e pegar esse jogo para ver se eu poderia jogar ao lado dele. Eu comprei o jogo, escolhi minha skin e mundo e comecei a jogar, mas eu estava preso no que você deveria fazer. Pedi ajuda ao meu filho e ele organizou um jogo para eu participar. Adorei, pois foi o melhor momento que passei com meu filho desde que minha esposa morreu. Desde então, esse jogo aproximou eu e meu filho novamente e agora passamos um tempo juntos fora de casa também. Este jogo me lembrou que há diversão em tudo, e trouxe muitas lembranças felizes para mim e meu filho.

review:
6/10

I don't highly recommend this game, it is simply alright. A slight above average is a great score to give this. While adding some new fun features to the Watch Dogs-gameplay, this entry overstays its welcome quickly and ultimately boils down to a bland experience.

Set a few years after Watch Dogs 2, you now play as basically any and all the citizens of London. You are a member of Dedsec and you are on a quest to counter terrorism by comitting crimes of terrorism. By hacking, shooting and sometimes sneaking in 4rd-person you finish missions, mess around in the city and find collectibles that add almost nothing to the experience. The story is alright, with some interesting characters and plotlines. Since you play as whoever you want, you do not go through any concrete character-development, you simply change who you play as. This is fine, and can be fun if you want to explore it. As I bought the gold edition of the game, I played the entire thing as Wrench from Watch Dogs 2 as I think his equipment is vastly superior to all other characters. The missions quickly become stale, as you do the same thing over and over, just in different city-settings. You drive to the site, you sneak and hack your way to the objective and then you either deffend it while getting swarmed by goons or steal it and sneak out. Sometimes you are in a car-chase, sometimes you solve small hacker-puzzles. That is basically it, and for some that is fine. There is nothing wrong with this system, it just never expands to anything on top of this. When you have played Watch Dogs: Legion for two hours, you have experienced close to everything that the game has to offer.

The game is about 12 hours long, shorter if you do not do any side-quests. I did all the quests and also played the DLC, Bloodline. That was much better than the base-game, as it had a much more involved and thought-out story with characters we know and love and that could be fleshed out through the gameplay. I liked it, the DLC is probably a 7.5/10.

+ Fun sandbox-gameplay with easy controls and mechanics
+ A nice gimmick to be able to play and recruit anyone as a playable character
+ Great soundtrack
+- a fun DLC. Sadly locked behind a paywall.
- Gameplay gets old really fast
- Very meh story

All in all, Watch Dogs: Legion is a fine game. No need to play it, but I doubt anyone will outright hate it. It does what it sets out to do in a satisfying but never mind-blowing way. Very bland but okay enough to not suggest staying away from. Buy it on a sale if you must play it for some reason.

review:
No diré que es un mal juego. Pero acabando de jugar Watchs Dogs 2 y pasar a esta entrega siento que existe un retroceso en las mecánicas de juego, suelen haber muchos bugs y la ciudad no se nota tan viva. 
La manera en la que que se mueven las camaras mientras conduces es tenaz, pues no te permiten apreciar el paisaje correctamente. La interfaz durante el juego está muy sobrecargada, me parecía mejor los recuadros un poco mas minimalistas de la entrega anterior.
Respecto a los agentes aunque parece una buena idea, se vuelve muy repetitiva la forma en la que los reclutas.

Aspectos positivos: Los graficos están mejor optimizados, ya que se nota una mejora respecto al WD2 con una mayor cantidad de FPS.

review: I played a ton on my Series S when I first got it. I know a lot of people aren't fans of this game, but it really scratches a specific itch for me, personally. I'm kind of a sucker for games that give you the pieces to make your own story, and the variation in characters you can find and become in Legion is just enough for me to develop them in my head as I play. It eventually gets me much more invested in these characters than i otherwise would be, knowing they're partially a series of characteristics unlikely to ever see in a single character again, part a character i've made on my own. Works well with the permadeath mode, leading to some devastating moments of loss; the system means that even starting a whole new game, you're unlikely to EVER see one of your operatives again. Proper story is "eh", online mode is decent imo, and Bloodlines is REALLY fun as a conclusion to Aiden's story but, yeah, I may be a bit biased here.

review:
Completed this game fully (over 70 hrs played in total) during its non-Steam era.

TL;DR: ridiculously overpriced game with very repetitive gameplay, and a unique take on game world and setting. Only for franchise fans. No achievements. Ubisoft Connect sucks lemons. Denuvo is still in the game and sucks balls.

Pros:
* Very unique feel and design of the game world, I mean it
* Some of the side quests are surprisingly emotionally touching
* Most, if not all of the game, can be stealthed through, much like Watch_Dogs 2
* Soundtrack is catchy, even though it's not perfect
* Bloodline DLC is a welcome addition in terms of game world's lore and some fan service
* Runs under Proton on Linux pretty much out-of-the-box

Cons:
* Graphics-wise, it's far from being cutting edge, but performance is meh at best
* Most of the gameplay is mind-numbingly repetitive, and in most cases, without any incentive for the player to continue. The main plot is very generic, and other than Sabrina and Skye, there are no memorable characters whatsoever. This is a very unfortunate downgrade comparing to Watch_Dogs 2
* Hacking is now very limited, compared to the WD1 or WD2, where in some cases I was able to ACTUALLY finish the mission (say, download data or kill the mark) without ever stepping foot into designated mission zone
* New "there's no single protagonist" take is not working as publisher tried to sell it: I've played most of the game with one single operative, and never felt any need to switch between them
* Vehicles physics are utter and complete garbage
* Micro-transactions are baked into the DNA of the game and core gameplay
* No Steam achievements, and no plans to implement them: see [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/2239550/discussions/0/3721693063165782063/?insideModal=1&ctp=19#c5501743907520278427]publisher's reply[/url][/u] on game's Community Hub forum

Also:
* F you very much, Ubisoft Connect app, a buggy POS, weiging 560+ megabytes per install, which has no reason to exist in the world where Steam and GOG do
* Some of performance issues can be attributed to the fact that after more than TWO YEARS after initial release, the game still has Denuvo integrated in it, the most carcinogenic DRM in existence. I guess that Ubisoft just doesn't care about user experience

In summary: there are some positive sides to this game, but unless you are at least remotely interested in the franchise and its lore, I recommend you to avoid this release. Full price of $59.99 for the base game and $99.99 for the lowest tier edition to include season pass is inexcusably high.

60元买来当作伦敦旅游模拟器玩的，只能说还原了80%的街道和20%的建筑，著名景点之外的很多大街小巷都跟记忆中不太一样。（Old Kent Road 怎么能没有阿三呢！）

I just want to see what happens when people stop buying.", "timestamp_created": 1678208447, "timestamp_updated": 1678208447, "voted_up": false, "votes_up": 1, "votes_funny": 0, "weighted_vote_score": "0.514285683631896973", "comment_count": 0, "steam_purchase": true, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false, "timestamp_dev_responded": 1678294137, "developer_response": "Hey there. I do apologize for the frustration caused by these crashes and bugs you've encountered in the game. There are a few things that I can recommend you try in order to get these issues resolved. First, I do recommend taking a few moments to run through our [url=https://ubi.li/4mnuS]Basic PC Troubleshooting[/url] guide. I especially recommend the steps that talk of [url=https://ubi.li/k3cYq]verifying your game files[/url] and [url=https://ubi.li/096ki]disabling your background applications[/url], just to ensure that these issues aren't being caused by any kind of corrupted game file or one of those background apps. I also suggest that, if it's not already, installing the game on the same drive that Steam and Ubisoft Connect are installed on. \n\nIf the game does continue to crash, or those bugs don't seem to ease up, go ahead and grab some copies of your [url=https://ubi.li/NAnxo]MSINFO and DxDiag[/url] files. Then, open a ticket with us on our [url=https://ubi.li/46uzK]Support Website[/url], get those files uploaded and provide a detailed description of the issue, as well as everything you've tried so far. Our agents will be able to provide further troubleshooting and will be able to get these issues reported for you from there. Thank you so much."}

review:
An interesting concept with the 'recruit anyone you like', but in many ways it feels like a step back. Really miss the flair and lightheartedness of WD2 because the series just had to take itself so seriously again. Many mechanics also feel rather barebones or shallow, hell Ubi couldn't even be bothered to add Steam achievements.

Worth it at the 80% discount I bought it for, but not much more.

review: I wanted to review this really good game by Ubisoft on my bday cuz its cool also its really interesting that in this game you can choose who will be main protagonist it can be someone without any abilities or with alot of them also its good that  DedSec is still here and it grows really fast with newer games of Watchdogs its also really interesting to control everything around you like:Drones,Cars,Everything.Also its really really really interesting that Legion have many enemies for to fight with like Richard Malik,Skye Larsen,Albion aka Nigel Cass,Clan Kelly and Zero Day also its really interesting that they bring back agein Aiden and Wrench from last two games Watchdogs:Legion is really good game with detail graphics and more also this game feels alive like RDR2 for example people walking,eating,speaking,driving and more its good game for sure worth the price 100% indeed.

review: If you liked Watch Dogs 2, I'd recommend Legion. Already quite stable. The London model is fantastic; you'll feel like you're there. You choose the protagonist literally from London citizens. Devs seem to have focused on personalization. It's about time someone did. Be whoever you want to be and use the character with the skill to accomplish specific missions. It's quite different from the current norm but an evolution in gaming and I think ubisoft is on the right track for the future.

review:
- Bagley die KI ist ein Arsch, Wörtlich und im Übertragenen Sinn. die Texte sind sowas für Script-Kidies (Bsp: mit einer Spider Drohne unterwegs im Gebäude Bagley "da wirste eine Spider Drohne brauchen")
- das Hacken in diesem Spiel ist kein Hacken; Der Müll war im Teil 1  schon nicht gut
- die KI vom Autopilot sollte noch mal in die Fahrschule gehen
- Quests Typen wiederholen sich, die Dummen Kommentare ebenfalls (kein Progress)

gute Punkte an dem Spiel:
- Kleidungsauswahl
- die verschiedenen "Polizei" Truppen bekämpfen sich gegenseitig wenn man sie lässt.

I'm sorry to see that the game keeps constantly crashing on you! To get these crashes eased up for you so that you can get back into the game, there are several things I recommend trying. First, I suggest ensuring that your system does meet the [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/watch-dogs-legion/article/system-requirements-for-watch-dogs-legion/000079857]minimum requirements[/url] for the game. If you do meet those requirements, then I instead suggest running through the steps we have outlined here in our [url=https://ubi.li/4mnuS]Basic PC Troubleshooting[/url] guide. I also suggest [url=https://ubi.li/k3cYq]verifying your game files[/url], along with [url=https://ubi.li/096ki]disabling your background applications[/url], just to ensure that these issues aren't being caused by a corrupted game file or a background application. \n\nIf the game does continue to crash even after giving those steps a try, please reach out to us by opening a ticket with us on our [url=https://ubi.li/46uzK]Support Website[/url]. When you do open that ticket, be sure to include copies of your [url=https://ubi.li/NAnxo]MSINFO and DxDiag[/url] files, along with a detailed list of everything you've tried so far. Thank you so much!"}

review:
Nem vou terminar de jogar de tão ruim que achei o jogo, infelizmente já não cumpro os requisitos para reembolso, senão pediria.

*Jogo oferece menos opções de hacks que o WD2. Na verdade você tem bastantes opções, mas o método para desbloqueá-los é chato, precisa ficar toda hora se desviando das missões principais e você só pode equipar certas coisas. Não dá pra usar ao mesmo tempo por exemplo gadget da aranha e a tech de ficar invisível


* Além de os recursos hacks serem limitados, você ainda fica capado na trocação de tiro, com drone voando pra tudo que é lado atirando enquanto você ainda tenta lidar com os seguranças. O jogo te obriga a ser stealth, mas faltam muitos recursos pra isso.

*Diálogos são esquisitos, cheios de gírias sem graça. Além de que tem uma IA que fica fazendo piadinha sem graça e enrolando pra dizer o local que você tem que ir, tornando o jogo lento e a progressão demorada. Sinceramente joguei por 5h e não entendi até que ponto a história progrediu. Até agora só sei que o grupo foi incriminado, estão tentando descobrir quem foi e é isso por longas 5h (talvez até mais).

Edit: Acabei zerando o jogo, mas o final também foi bem esquisito. Definitivamente não recomendo.

review:
"HISTORY WILL REMEMBER" well history won't but Steam players sure will. Ubisoft's Chris Early spoke out against Valve's PC digital store, Steam, saying its business model is "unrealistic." He added, "It doesn't reflect where the world is today in terms of game distribution."

Welcome back to the realistic current world ubisoft.
Now that Ubi is in financial trouble they come slinking back to Steam, tail between their legs begging everyone to ignore their crappy practices and to give them more money.

Now watch this refund button in action..

review:
[h1] 一句话总结：一坨精心包装过的答辩。[/h1]

[b]我会用我的感觉来客观评价这款游戏的优缺点，如果你有不同的看法欢迎在该评测下留言。当然，不喜勿喷。 [/b]

首先我们来说一下游戏背景。

近现代的伦敦，我们熟悉的组织Dedsec在某次任务中被人陷害，成员或被捕或逃亡或生死不明。你将需要重新组织Dedsec的成员，查出事件原因，复仇。

[b]那么我们先来说下优点 [/b]

1. 场景

大家都知道，育碧的场景还是那么可圈可点的。近现代的伦敦，科技的便利无时无刻影响着人们。熟悉的地标也能时刻映入眼帘。部分细节也能时刻提醒着玩家这是一个未来世界。

2. 炒冷饭

一代主角：[i] 艾登[/i]以及二代出圈角色：[i] 扳手 [/i]也将在游戏内出现。作为多角色的玩法，游戏内你也可以操控艾登和扳手来协助你完成任务。对于玩过看门狗主题的玩家来说，这两个角色属实印象深刻。这一波炒冷饭属实是炒到玩家的胃里了。

[b]接下来我会来告诉大家，为什么我能嗅出这是一坨答辩的。[/b] [spoiler] 内容包含部分国粹，语气助词，不要过渡揣测。 [/spoiler]

1. 登录

作为一款单人游戏+线上多人合作游戏。（注意，我这里用的是加号）那么你肯定要在满足了单人的情况下，才能继续满足线上多人才对。但是如果你无法登录那个什么瘠薄土豆服务器。你会卡在游戏的登录页面，[b]重点是在这个时候你无法进行任何操作，包括退出游戏的操作。[/b] 正常来说玩家无法登录服务器，那么是不是应该出现以下两种情况：

1）无法连接至服务器，即将开始离线单人玩法。[spoiler] 上上策 [/spoiler]

2）无法连接至服务器，即将退出游戏。[spoiler]中策 [/spoiler]

哎嘿，可它倒好，人家直接给你卡在登录界面无法进行下一步。你只能切到电脑主页通过任务管理处关闭游戏的方法来实现退出游戏。哥，2023年了，不会还有单人游戏因为不联网导致无法进入游戏吧？如果因为这样咱就是说把单人游戏的标签撤掉可以吗？[b] 这些问题我觉得把负责这一块的开发和测试都裁了吧。属实是没脑子。 [/b]

2. 多主角操控

一开始你听到这个词是不是觉得哇塞，看门狗也开始学三人一狗来玩多主角的套路了？错，这个多主角的意思是游戏内并没有主角。你是一个团队，你需要自己选择团队成员，控制团队成员完成任务。那既然这样，是不是各个团队成员应该有各自独特的能力？最好的成功线上产品之一，比如彩虹六号？但是游戏内这些可选择的团队成员仅仅在描述上让你发现不同。真正的使用起来，除了个别成员存在无法躲在掩体后和无法加速跑这种debuff让你感觉到确实有明显的差异，其他的东西都可以通过技能树内的机器人以及枪械来弥补。而且这些东西都是开局基本就可以解锁的。所以咱就是说，这个多主角有什么意义？技能无法呈现，性格也没体现，那你这个系统的意义，我的评价是不如单主角。还能方便你去刻画它的性格特征。[b] 咱就是说，这些系统的东西策划就不能写个xmind内部讨论一下吗？这么傻逼的东西都能上线属实是看不懂啊。 [/b]

3. 扫描

看门狗系列最出彩的当然是扫描了。扫描，简单概括就是按一个键，可以扫描出附近有哪些可交互的物品。一般都是快速查看哪些东西可以黑入，给玩家带来便利。可惜这一代的扫描功能退化了，其一就是扫描出来的物体描绘框很不明显，基本和地图背景融为一体，扫描完我甚至根本看不到那里他妈的有个摄像头。其次是扫描的持续时间变短了，前作的扫描结束后物体会有个3-5秒的描绘框呈现，而现在扫描完基本立刻消失。我是真没想到他们能把最得意，最有代表特色的系统给做了个退化处理。属实是在答辩的上面又踩了一脚。

4. 技能树

技能树其实也是看门狗独特的玩法之一。前两部作品的技能树可以为你的角色创造出多重不同的玩法。最简单的例子就是在看门狗2内，技能树包含了电池，大规模停电，机器人及直升机的拓展能力等。而在看门狗：军团里，你的技能树变成了：机器人 → 多了个跳跃的机器人 → 多了个没用的技能的机器人；一把枪 → 一把多了一发子弹的枪 → 一把装弹速度更快了的枪。毕竟他要把技能树上的部分内容移植到多角色系统中去。但是你这个技能树是不是也太敷衍了一点？实在做不出来新的内容你直接复制粘贴前代技能树玩家们也不会骂你不是？极品飞车出了那么多代了氮气依旧还是氮气啊。而你却把独特的玩法系统给做减法就算了，还把关键内容给减了属实是没看懂。

5. 地图可交互物

玩过看门狗的玩家，耳熟能详的应该就是地面上的燃气爆炸，以及修改红绿灯这些黑入选项了。毕竟你是一个黑客，而不是崔佛。你更多的是需要通过黑入某些物体来摆脱追捕或者跟上你的目标。但不好意思，这些内容我好像在看门狗：军团内都没有看到。本身黑客就需要大量的黑入，才是核心体验。可如今你的黑客更多的是，大量的查看我前面这位帅哥拥有什么技能，我能不能招募他。咱就是说你这些技能做的毫无特色，又为何让其他已经完美的系统去做它的陪衬呢？
简单点来说就是，这一代的地图内可交互的物品属实是少了很多。游戏的可玩性真的再大大减少，相比之下增加的确实什么无拳套格斗以及送快递（？）你怎么不直接让我去搬砖呢？

6. 过程动画

游戏是2020年底发行的，相比较之下三人一狗则是2013年面世的。我能感受出你想把别人好的地方给学过来，比如我有一次打开游戏发现扳手在喝酒，而且在自言自语说了一点无心的话。这是学到了，但是你过场动画的衔接怎么还在用那种走到点按E开始balabalabala对话而且人物僵硬表情无法呈现？2013年三人一狗就已经能把游戏和动画完美的衔接上了。愿意花大几十甚至是冤大头用原价来玩这款游戏，怎么说也会瞄个一两眼剧情，就算玩家不看，你做了好的衔接玩家也会觉得你是在用心的去优化体验。在这一点上看门狗2做的就已经还不错了，但是怎么到了看门狗：军团上反倒还退化了呢？

[h1] 本人在写这篇评测的时候还没有通关，而且我竟然时隔10年玩这款游戏出现了晕3D的现象。休息一会会继续玩下去，如果有新的想法会随时修改该评测 [/h1]

[b] 最后说一下，实在做不出东西，咱们就换个皮，抄东西。如果你连这个都做不好，我的建议是把IP卖了赶紧转行别糟蹋它了。 [/b]

3. 扫描

看门狗系列最出彩的当然是扫描了。扫描，简单概括就是按一个键，可以扫描出附近有哪些可交互的物品。一般都是快速查看哪些东西可以黑入，给玩家带来便利。可惜这一代的扫描功能退化了，其一就是扫描出来的物体描绘框很不明显，基本和地图背景融为一体，扫描完我甚至根本看不到那里他妈的有个摄像头。其次是扫描的持续时间变短了，前作的扫描结束后物体会有个3-5秒的描绘框呈现，而现在扫描完基本立刻消失。我是真没想到他们能把最得意，最有代表特色的系统给做了个退化处理。属实是在答辩的上面又踩了一脚。

4. 技能树

技能树其实也是看门狗独特的玩法之一。前两部作品的技能树可以为你的角色创造出多重不同的玩法。最简单的例子就是在看门狗2内，技能树包含了电池，大规模停电，机器人及直升机的拓展能力等。而在看门狗：军团里，你的技能树变成了：机器人 → 多了个跳跃的机器人 → 多了个没用的技能的机器人；一把枪 → 一把多了一发子弹的枪 → 一把装弹速度更快了的枪。毕竟他要把技能树上的部分内容移植到多角色系统中去。但是你这个技能树是不是也太敷衍了一点？实在做不出来新的内容你直接复制粘贴前代技能树玩家们也不会骂你不是？极品飞车出了那么多代了氮气依旧还是氮气啊。而你却把独特的玩法系统给做减法就算了，还把关键内容给减了属实是没看懂。

5. 地图可交互物

玩过看门狗的玩家，耳熟能详的应该就是地面上的燃气爆炸，以及修改红绿灯这些黑入选项了。毕竟你是一个黑客，而不是崔佛。你更多的是需要通过黑入某些物体来摆脱追捕或者跟上你的目标。但不好意思，这些内容我好像在看门狗：军团内都没有看到。本身黑客就需要大量的黑入，才是核心体验。可如今你的黑客更多的是，大量的查看我前面这位帅哥拥有什么技能，我能不能招募他。咱就是说你这些技能做的毫无特色，又为何让其他已经完美的系统去做它的陪衬呢？
简单点来说就是，这一代的地图内可交互的物品属实是少了很多。游戏的可玩性真的再大大减少，相比之下增加的确实什么无拳套格斗以及送快递（？）你怎么不直接让我去搬砖呢？

6. 过程动画

游戏是2020年底发行的，相比较之下三人一狗则是2013年面世的。我能感受出你想把别人好的地方给学过来，比如我有一次打开游戏发现扳手在喝酒，而且在自言自语说了一点无心的话。这是学到了，但是你过场动画的衔接怎么还在用那种走到点按E开始balabalabala对话而且人物僵硬表情无法呈现？2013年三人一狗就已经能把游戏和动画完美的衔接上了。愿意花大几十甚至是冤大头用原价来玩这款游戏，怎么说也会瞄个一两眼剧情，就算玩家不看，你做了好的衔接玩家也会觉得你是在用心的去优化体验。在这一点上看门狗2做的就已经还不错了，但是怎么到了看门狗：军团上反倒还退化了呢？

[h1] 本人在写这篇评测的时候还没有通关，而且我竟然时隔10年玩这款游戏出现了晕3D的现象。休息一会会继续玩下去，如果有新的想法会随时修改该评测 [/h1]

[b] 最后说一下，实在做不出东西，咱们就换个皮，抄东西。如果你连这个都做不好，我的建议是把IP卖了赶紧转行别糟蹋它了。 [/b]", "timestamp_created": 1678385991, "timestamp_updated": 1678386259, "voted_up": false, "votes_up": 46, "votes_funny": 5, "weighted_vote_score": "0.802811324596405029", "comment_count": 0, "steam_purchase": true, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

Stop with the Uplay crap, Ubisoft. No one wants it, stop it.

review:
I cannot understand why there are so many thumbs down for this game. for one, London is brilliant. The world is vibrant and feels alive, and graphically (so long as your rig can handle it) it's stunning. My only recommendation is that you only ever play this game in resistance mode, i.e with perma-death switched on. This way there is a very real sense of loss when you lose one of your best and longest lived operatives, and the consequences of making a mistake feel very real and will add weight to your choices.
Don't listen to the short attention span brigade, who will always thumb down a game if it doesn't give them a cookie every 2 minutes, and play this game as it was intended to be played, on full resistance mode. This way you feel like the underdog, where the system you're trying to fight is just to big, and the death of a key operator will hit you hard as though you've suffered a genuine loss.
Good game!

review:
41个小时左右，反抗军通关，实际上本作剧情并不长，主要是招募探员太花时间，而且反抗军里还要担心角色永久死亡的问题，真的是：别玩！折磨的还是你自己！！！
选普通的，然后难度选困难+开启永久死亡模式就和反抗军一样了，招到喜欢的角色了怕死把永久死亡关了就行，直接选反抗军不能关永久死亡！！！

心态炸裂的第一次是好不容易招到一个好看声音还算可以的小姐姐，结果开车撞红叉那种可以破坏的木板，后面是个油罐！！！直接寄了！心态瞬间爆炸！！！[spoiler] 反正后面也通关了，部分关卡可以无视死亡反复挑战 [/spoiler]

现在来说一下本作的优缺点：
优点：
风景、艺术这些都是育碧的优点，就算开车在游戏里逛风景也是挺好的选择。
本作创新加入了永久死亡机制，即探员是随机生成又会随之死亡的，以提醒各位玩家珍惜探员生命，这不是游戏。
独特的探员技能组合。
剧情任务有深度，不是白开水（[spoiler] 有种《Person of Interest》的感觉了 [/spoiler]）。
部分关卡设计具有新意，新玩法。
艾登·皮尔斯回归，可以再次体验到狗哥的新原创剧情。

缺点：
永久死亡的机制导致仍然存在缺点，比如不能自己捏人，调整开局人物，只能在给的探员里面选，这就导致了坏的（街上能招募的探员大多数真的是一言难尽）随便选，遇到好的舍不得用。
育碧特色巨多的任务点和收集道具，导致本作体验上不如《Watch Dogs》一代较线性流程，而且收集要素也不会很影响游戏体验。
任务繁杂，各种任务都有，特别是招募每个探员所花的时间跟做任务一样多，很不合理。
部分关卡真的是没活整了，比如让你下载个东西，不停地出小兵恶心你，Dedsec同时就一个人出战，但是敌人各种武器都有，养了这么多探员都不能一起上，真就让一个人对抗一支军队啊？而且本作武器的射击手感稀烂，子弹又少，真的部分关卡就纯粹恶心玩家。还有就是玩线上，本来人物血量就多，跑动起来加上延迟根本打不中！我的评价是不如好好做好剧情，和以前单人穿插多人的模式一样，不要搞什么通行证阶级了，本来就不是网游，非要得网游的病！


总之，《Watch Dogs: Legion》算是具有创新性的一作，希望以后还能见到看门狗系列的续作吧！（[spoiler] 做好剧情就行了，非要搞什么多人，不理解 [/spoiler]）

永久死亡的机制导致仍然存在缺点，比如不能自己捏人，调整开局人物，只能在给的探员里面选，这就导致了坏的（街上能招募的探员大多数真的是一言难尽）随便选，遇到好的舍不得用。
育碧特色巨多的任务点和收集道具，导致本作体验上不如《Watch Dogs》一代较线性流程，而且收集要素也不会很影响游戏体验。
任务繁杂，各种任务都有，特别是招募每个探员所花的时间跟做任务一样多，很不合理。
部分关卡真的是没活整了，比如让你下载个东西，不停地出小兵恶心你，Dedsec同时就一个人出战，但是敌人各种武器都有，养了这么多探员都不能一起上，真就让一个人对抗一支军队啊？而且本作武器的射击手感稀烂，子弹又少，真的部分关卡就纯粹恶心玩家。还有就是玩线上，本来人物血量就多，跑动起来加上延迟根本打不中！我的评价是不如好好做好剧情，和以前单人穿插多人的模式一样，不要搞什么通行证阶级了，本来就不是网游，非要得网游的病！


总之，《Watch Dogs: Legion》算是具有创新性的一作，希望以后还能见到看门狗系列的续作吧！（[spoiler] 做好剧情就行了，非要搞什么多人，不理解 [/spoiler]）", "timestamp_created": 1678423772, "timestamp_updated": 1678423772, "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "weighted_vote_score": 0.5, "comment_count": 0, "steam_purchase": true, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

review:
Это не игра а з@лупа какая то!!!
Режим сопротивление тупо дизбалансный, отлетаешь с 3-ёх пуль без права переиграть, потому что если перс сдох, то его только удалять из списка, даже длсишного, даже донатного!
Но если хоть как то пытаешься понять, как играть то серваки кусков г@вна, по кличке юбисофт не доступны, и с какого момента не доступны, то с того момента не сохраняется игра, я так проеб@л 4 часа геймплея, а теперь даже продолжать на этот кал своё время не желаю!!!
Так что люди, будьте умнеее, обходите этот шлак стороной, первая и вторая намного лучше смотрится, тут даже не чуствуется романтика хакера, весь хакеризм е этой игре это отодвинуть машинку, оправить боту мемас и по управлять чужим дроном одну минуточку!!!

review:
I didn't want to do a review before I finished the story from the game but I'm really tired of how many bugs the game has.
Not to bore you, I won't talk about the story of the game because even if it's good with so many issues the game has it doesn't let you enjoy it.
I won't talk about every single bug the game has I will talk about the one that has bored me the most of all.
Every time I do customize a character every single but every single time the game will crash and throw me out I get burned out this happens almost every time I go to customize my player.
And no it's not an issue my pc who wants to can go into my profile and will see what I have in it so he will know it's not a pc issue.
I'm really really upset with a lot of companies out there that release hate finished work.
I hope someday this will change because gaming is slowly being destroyed like this.

review:
[h1]Spielbewertung von TrophyHunter[/h1]

Dieses Spiel habe ich, glaube ich, über ein "HumbleBundle-Pack" bekommen und fing direkt danach an mit dem Download. Ich habe früher schon "Watch Dogs 1" gezockt und war vollkommen vom Spielprinzip begeistert. Leider bin ich noch nicht in den Genuss vom 2 Teil gekommen. Vielleicht überzeugt mich dieser mehr als der Aktuelle hier.

In "Watch Dogs: Legion" versucht man in London eine Widerstandsgruppe gegen den Terrorismus aufzubauen. Während man alles dafür tut, um die Gruppe zu vergrößern, begegnet man immer wieder "Bezirks-Bosse". Diese leiten jeweils, wie der Name schon sagt einzelne Bezirke, welche man nach und nach auch übernehmen muss. Sounds und Musikauswahl ist ganz okay und die Grafik bzw. visuelle Darstellung ist ganz gut gelungen, jedoch gibt es hier und da mal kleinere bis größere Grafikbugs. In den ersten Missionen war alles super, man hatte richtig Spaß gehabt, bekam immer bessere Sachen, Charaktere, Waffen und noch vieles mehr dazu. Hört sich ja alles ganz cool an, ABER ich muss leider sagen, dass bspw. der Missionsaufbau echt schlauchig gestaltet wurde. Du fährst von A zu B, um X zu finden/töten oder schaltest dir ein paar neue Charaktere frei. Ganz ehrlich, die Nebenmissionen haben mehr Spaß gemacht als die Storyline selbst, da die Nebenmissionen durch ihre Vielfältigkeit deutlich mehr Abwechslung bieten konnten, weshalb ich inzwischen auch die 40 Stunden im Spiel verbracht habe. Innerhalb den ersten Spielstunden bekommt man jedenfalls das Gefühl, dass man bereits alles gesehen hat, weshalb das Gameplay sehr schnell, sehr langweilig wurde. Die KI bzw. die potenziellen Spielfiguren haben scheinbar keinen eigenen Charakter, da sie mit unter alle die gleichen Sprüche raushauen. Das gleiche zählt auch für das Skill-System, welches im Spiel integriert wurde. Es ist total unrealistisch, dass eine Oma bspw. schneller Laufen kann, als ein durchtrainierter Mann im Alter von 26 Jahren. Dementsprechend passen die visuellen Darstellungen nicht mit den Eigenschaften und Skills überein. Durch dieses Skill-System ist es übrigens etwas komplizierter an gute Waffen ran zu kommen, da diese als "Skill" bzw. "Perk" gesehen werden. Man braucht viel Glück, um einen halbwegs guten Charakter zu finden. Warum kann man nicht einfach die Perks selbst "erlernen" oder zumindest mit seinen Charakteren untereinander austauschen? Ebenso hat das Spiel auch keine Errungenschaften auf Steam, was ich persönlich auch sehr schade finde. Zu guter letzt ist es noch notwendig die etwas gewöhnungsbedürftige Steuerung zu erwähnen.

Ich persönlich hatte wie bereits erwähnt am Anfang sehr viel Spaß und Laune das Spiel zu zocken. Leider habe ich mit der Zeit die Motivation dafür verloren. Das Spiel und die Umsetzung ist eigentlich nicht schlecht, aber leider für lange Sicht nicht brauchbar. Die Story kann dich einfach nicht richtig fesseln. Dafür fehlt es an dem gewissen etwas. Zudem ist der Preis von 59,99€ etwas zu hoch in meinen Augen. Macht euch am besten eine eigene Meinung und wie immer empfehle ich euch das Spiel wenn dann in einem Sale zu erwerben.

raw_json:
{"recommendationid": "134422791", "author": {"steamid": "76561198962733287", "num_games_owned": 4787, "num_reviews": 592, "playtime_forever": 2432, "playtime_last_two_weeks": 0, "playtime_at_review": 2432, "last_played": 1676323508}, "language": "german", "review": "[h1]Spielbewertung von TrophyHunter[/h1]

Dieses Spiel habe ich, glaube ich, über ein "HumbleBundle-Pack" bekommen und fing direkt danach an mit dem Download. Ich habe früher schon "Watch Dogs 1" gezockt und war vollkommen vom Spielprinzip begeistert. Leider bin ich noch nicht in den Genuss vom 2 Teil gekommen. Vielleicht überzeugt mich dieser mehr als der Aktuelle hier.

In "Watch Dogs: Legion" versucht man in London eine Widerstandsgruppe gegen den Terrorismus aufzubauen. Während man alles dafür tut, um die Gruppe zu vergrößern, begegnet man immer wieder "Bezirks-Bosse". Diese leiten jeweils, wie der Name schon sagt einzelne Bezirke, welche man nach und nach auch übernehmen muss. Sounds und Musikauswahl ist ganz okay und die Grafik bzw. visuelle Darstellung ist ganz gut gelungen, jedoch gibt es hier und da mal kleinere bis größere Grafikbugs. In den ersten Missionen war alles super, man hatte richtig Spaß gehabt, bekam immer bessere Sachen, Charaktere, Waffen und noch vieles mehr dazu. Hört sich ja alles ganz cool an, ABER ich muss leider sagen, dass bspw. der Missionsaufbau echt schlauchig gestaltet wurde. Du fährst von A zu B, um X zu finden/töten oder schaltest dir ein paar neue Charaktere frei. Ganz ehrlich, die Nebenmissionen haben mehr Spaß gemacht als die Storyline selbst, da die Nebenmissionen durch ihre Vielfältigkeit deutlich mehr Abwechslung bieten konnten, weshalb ich inzwischen auch die 40 Stunden im Spiel verbracht habe. Innerhalb den ersten Spielstunden bekommt man jedenfalls das Gefühl, dass man bereits alles gesehen hat, weshalb das Gameplay sehr schnell, sehr langweilig wurde. Die KI bzw. die potenziellen Spielfiguren haben scheinbar keinen eigenen Charakter, da sie mit unter alle die gleichen Sprüche raushauen. Das gleiche zählt auch für das Skill-System, welches im Spiel integriert wurde. Es ist total unrealistisch, dass eine Oma bspw. schneller Laufen kann, als ein durchtrainierter Mann im Alter von 26 Jahren. Dementsprechend passen die visuellen Darstellungen nicht mit den Eigenschaften und Skills überein. Durch dieses Skill-System ist es übrigens etwas komplizierter an gute Waffen ran zu kommen, da diese als "Skill" bzw. "Perk" gesehen werden. Man braucht viel Glück, um einen halbwegs guten Charakter zu finden. Warum kann man nicht einfach die Perks selbst "erlernen" oder zumindest mit seinen Charakteren untereinander austauschen? Ebenso hat das Spiel auch keine Errungenschaften auf Steam, was ich persönlich auch sehr schade finde. Zu guter letzt ist es noch notwendig die etwas gewöhnungsbedürftige Steuerung zu erwähnen.

Ich persönlich hatte wie bereits erwähnt am Anfang sehr viel Spaß und Laune das Spiel zu zocken. Leider habe ich mit der Zeit die Motivation dafür verloren. Das Spiel und die Umsetzung ist eigentlich nicht schlecht, aber leider für lange Sicht nicht brauchbar. Die Story kann dich einfach nicht richtig fesseln. Dafür fehlt es an dem gewissen etwas. Zudem ist der Preis von 59,99€ etwas zu hoch in meinen Augen. Macht euch am besten eine eigene Meinung und wie immer empfehle ich euch das Spiel wenn dann in einem Sale zu erwerben.

review:
Tek kelimeyle özetlemek gerekirse;

Saints Row: The Third Remake olmuş bu oyun

Grafik Kalitesi : A.R.O.G'ta zaman makinasını bulup, deminden şimdiye gelen adam gibi.En yükseğide
en düşüğüde aynı.Seçenek olarak var ama oynanışta bir grafik kalitesi yok.Hepsi aynı.

Araba Sürüş Mekaniği : Matrix filminin oyun demosundaki araçlar gibi hazır oradan buraya
kopyala yapıştır yapmışlar gibi araba savruluyor oyunu yapmayı bitirip abi biz buna araba sürüş mekaniği koymadık
demişlerdir.Watch Dogs 2 deki sürüş mekaniğini direk koysanızda olurda idare ederdi yani.

Işıklandırmada bir sorun var, gün ışığının vurduğu heryer sırlar dünyasına dönüyor.

Ben oyunu kötü grafik kalitesi, ışıklandırma sorunu, watch dogs2den de berbat araba sürüş mekanikleri nedeniyle hikayeyi oynamadan bıraktım.Ve tavsiye etmiyorum.Çünkü açık dünya oyunlarında hikayesi, araç sürmek ve grafik ve çevre detayları göze hoş geliyor.Herkes bunlar için oynuyor 

Watch Dogs 2 deki grafik kalitesi ve araba sürüş mekanikleri korunarak bu oyun yapılsaydı ben bu oyunu farklı atmosferinden ve açık dünyasından dolayı sırf hikayeyi bitirmek için bile oynardım.Çünkü şehirde gezdiğimiz açık dünya oyunlarına bayılıyorum ama gel gör ki oyun bir oyunun beta sürecinde hazırlanmışta grafikleri sonradan geliştirilecek gibi emin olun grafik kalitesi nedeniyle hiç beğenmeyeceksiniz.

review:
Not really a good game. London is visualized amazingly, though.
What makes Legion a bad game:
- You cannot jump - unless absolutely required (parcours)
- Controls are unprecise
- You do not build up a real connection to your agents as they are soo arbitrary
- Spawning of enemies is "surprising"
- No quicksave or quickload - which is necessary due to controls.
Overall: "Meh". Bad game, London great - which keeps me pulling back.

tips for new player : get the starter character with guns, fast hack, etc that actually really improve the stat. not item drone or other kind

review:
I remember years back when I first saw the trailer. Man, I was stoked to play this... then it got delayed, which in my book was fine... maybe Ubi needed some time to polish and make this game just that good.  

Today, I can confidently classify this game as a "Meh simulator." You definitely will have more entertainment value from the trailer than the actual gameplay. Graphically it's fine, and the London overscape is fine, but it's just so hollow and empty and void of immersion. Everything is so linear with no attrition whatsoever and the stealth is atrocious. There is no doubt some major budget cuts were made for this one... it shows. 

Here is how this likely roll out for y'all. You will eyeball this game and see there are quite a few negative reviews. One day, it goes on sale, and despite the reviews you pick it up anyhow (to Hell with those reviews, right?) You quickly realize it's a Meh Simulator and it hangs out in your steam library unplayed, until one day you decide to clear it out to make space for games you actually play.

TLDR: Game is Meh AF.

review:
[h1] Аванпосты и покемоны. [/h1]
- Весь геймплей, это буквально, рейд аванпостов по кругу.
   В надежде на изменение.
   Интересного контента, постановочных миссий в игре нету.
-Паркур деградировал, даже хуже чем в 1 части.  

+Есть, красивый, проработанный Лондон.
https://youtu.be/RsX1JybbOmU
+Можно рекрутировать, закастомить и играть, за любого персонажа.
(от престарелой бабули, с критическим шансом случайно откинутся, от сердечного приступа, до Джона вика)
[strike] Оружие привязано к персонажу, подобрать или купить нельзя. [/strike]
+Вождение стало лучше, даже лучше, чем в гта, имхо.
+Стрельба стала приятнее, вроде, но разницы в стрельбе между пп и ак нету.

Вывод: Ну такое. 😒 Посоветовал бы я такое? Скорее, нет, чем да.

review: I buy this game with a 70% discount so the game only cost me about HKD80 and I think this game still have a lot of improvement on game-play because the most useful is the sneaking spider. In your mid-game u will unlock some overpowered agent and you can start using the riffle and rush inside. There are still some non-critical bug. Compare to Watchdog 2, Legion is not the same level of Watchdog 2. However, it is still commanded to play if the game only have a at least 70%off or more discount. The plot and gameplay is not that good though. :(

review:
El juego en si esta bueno, son mejores el 1 y el 2 pero para los que se quedaron con ganas de mas, este te puede saciar *algo*
La mecánica de reclutamiento y el no tener un personaje principal lo hace interesante
Historia interesante (no voy a espolear nada)
Sistema de combate y armas esta bueno
Sistema de parkour similar al 2 
Gráficas muy buenos
Sonidos y música excelentes 
Falto la traducción al español latino pero al menos tenemos el español *joder tio*
Multijugador activo hasta la fecha

Porque no lo recomiendo? es facil... UBISOFT o BUGUISOFT, sigue teniendo bugs
NPCs que se tele-transportan y en muchos casos al frente de tu auto
Bugs de gráficos, las texturas se distorsionan 
El soporte de UBI no te da ni 5 de pelotas
Y para rematar, el juego teniendo bugs, los de UBI dijeron que el game ya no esta en desarrollo y no van a sacar mas parches

review: What's up with all the haters? This game is really good on its own and compared to the last ones.  Who cares if they're doing cash grabs, there is so much content in-game - just don't buy anything.  I love all the puzzles and collectibles. I could spend months in the campaign just walking around these gorgeous maps.  The game runs very well for me, haven't had any issues. Love the character development and voice acting.  I got this game for 12 bucks when it went on sale...what a steal :) Good job, Ubisoft!

To get the game running properly again, I first suggest ensuring that your system does the meet the [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/watch-dogs-legion/article/system-requirements-for-watch-dogs-legion/000079857]minimum requirements[/url] for the game. If the system does meet the requirements, I instead suggest that you run through the steps that are listed out in our [url=https://ubi.li/4mnuS]Basic PC Troubleshooting[/url] guide. I especially recommend that you [url=https://ubi.li/k3cYq]verify your game files[/url] as well as [url=https://ubi.li/096ki]disable your background applications[/url], as sometimes these issues can be caused by a corrupted game file or one of those background applications.\n\nOne last thing that I do suggest would be to ensure that the game is installed on the same drive that you have Steam and Ubisoft Connect installed on. If the game still won't launch properly, then please open a ticket with us on our [url=https://ubi.li/46uzK]Support Website[/url]. When opening that ticket, be sure to include copies of your [url=https://ubi.li/NAnxo]MSINFO and DxDiag[/url] files, as well as a detailed list of everything that you've tried so far to get the game to start up. Thank you so much."}

review:
this game is super strange. I highly recommend getting this on sale because no way this game deserves the 90 bucks mark

the characters run like they shit their pants. the playable characters dont fit cutscenes are just straight up weird. they end up saying weird stuff to the objective that make no sense at all

overall 3/10 just very messy and outright boring

I was pleasantly surprised with how deeply I was immersed in building my rag tag group of would be Watch Dogs, even to the point of deep diving into each and every prospect to see if they had associates who would also be good to bring on board or a quick loose end I could help them with, not even talking to them to start the mission to recruit them. Just on my own. Like a true Dedsec would, in the shadows. Next thing you know, I'm 55 hours in, and I'm still inspecting my team and their friends/family/associates to find the best of the best for my rag tag group. 

I truly hope they haven't shelved this concept for building up a team. I feel it could work well with other Ubisoft titles in the future and lend to some incredibly fun and immersive games.

review:
¿Crees que eres intocable?
Estoy aquí para acabar con tus ilusiones.

- Aiden Pearce

I wanted to like this game, but it is just not that great. I don't hate it, but I don't recommend it. The hacking theme is cool on paper, but in practice it ends up being used in a limited set of ways, or as window dressing for a lot of mundane "press E to hack" or "stand near a thing while a bar fills up" interactions, and the heavy sandbox aspect ends up working against the world and making everything feel a bit sterile IMO.

All the mechanics feel unpolished and underdeveloped, and so nothing felt solid or satisfying while playing. The movement is stiff and awkward. Stealth and combat feel like they did the bare minimum for a third-person cover shooter, even though that is what you will spend 90% of the game doing. Driving is slippery but functional. Flying drones is also functional but again doesn't do anything noteworthy. Many collectibles in the levels are out of the way in hard to reach locations and require tedious amounts of traversal/platforming in a game that is not built for it. Clipping glitches will cause you to suddenly take damage for no reason even when walking on the ground normally. I have already seen multiple floating NPCs, NPCs running into walls, or NPCs stuck in terrain.

The missions start to feel same-y quickly, and some locations get re-used for multiple missions. They all essentially boil down to "sneak in here, unlock a door/find a key, interact with a thing, leave." Sometimes you have to steal a car and drive it somewhere, or a forced gunfight, but that is essentially it. There are piles of audio logs and flavor text, but they mostly just reiterate the main themes of the game which you got from the intro about evil corporations being evil.

The "play as anyone" system is neat, but aside from a few unique bonuses, the characters don't vary enough to matter, and the voice acting suffers badly for it. Because you might enter into a story conversation as any given character/voice actor, it is painfully obvious that all the dialogue is completely disjointed and tonally inconsistent. It doesn't even sound like two separate conversations, but rather a bunch of isolated voice clips being spliced into a sequence, which I suspect may not be far from the truth. You may begin noticing recycled dialogue lines if you play as one character long enough.

review:
总的来说不算推荐，还没买狐狸和扳手的dlc，仅评价本体内容
先说优点
1.伦敦城很漂亮，各处闪烁着的全息海报和满街的无人驾驶车辆让这座历史悠久的城市焕发出了新的生机
2.人物动作流畅自然，处决动作爽快
3.主线质量尚可
4.解谜内容比起前作有不少提升，增加了趣味性

缺点就太多了
1.游玩流程枯燥乏味，解放区域非常无聊，都是跑到目标点杀个人或者摸个终端
2.驾驶手感还是很差，刹车跟失灵了一样，一点刹车力度都没有，转向也很不灵敏，这两个问题导致开车过弯经常推头
3.军团系统就是一坨屎，卖点是可以招募街上任意路人，但是强力的角色只有几种，强力的角色长得不一定好看，好看的角色不一定强力，只能浪费时间去满大街找人，或者直接ce改
4.角色丑得千奇百怪
5.据点解放缺乏设计，唯一的迷题就是设计个没楼梯的高楼，然后让玩家黑个云梯车或者运货无人机飞上去
暂时就想到这些，只能说是经典育碧罐头，对育碧游戏耐受性强或者看门狗死忠粉可以玩玩。

review:
"Watch Dogs: Legion" is a fantastic addition to the Watch Dogs franchise that offers an immersive open-world experience unlike any other. With its innovative "Play as Anyone" feature, you can recruit and play as any character in the game's vast London setting, each with their own unique abilities and backstory.

The gameplay mechanics are smooth and responsive, allowing for seamless transitions between stealth and action-packed combat. The story is engaging and filled with twists and turns that keep you on the edge of your seat, while the graphics and sound design create a truly immersive experience.

One of the most impressive aspects of "Watch Dogs: Legion" is the attention to detail that Ubisoft has put into the game. From the realistic portrayal of London's landmarks to the diverse range of characters and their respective accents, every element of the game feels authentic and well-crafted.

Overall, "Watch Dogs: Legion" is a must-play for any open-world or action-adventure game fan. With its innovative gameplay, engaging story, and impressive attention to detail, it's a game that will keep you coming back for more. Highly recommended!

review:
Cyberpunk: Post-Brexit Britain. Also, Saints Row: United Colours of Chav Edition.

Painfully on-the-nose, in terms of its real world political commentary. Colder and darker than the last game in the series, without reaching the jaded cynicism of the debut title. The 'recruit and be anyone' character system and its attached customization options rival Saints Row, while the open world is one of the best in the industry, rivalling even GTA.

Stunning graphical presentation with RT on. Runs well on my 5900/4090 combo, with crisp gunplay and zero issues with gameworld streaming while racing through the city. The driving model is also a huge step up from the series earlier failings in this regard, too.

Best recreation of London I've seen in a computer game, but then, that's one of Ubi's development strengths.

The game's two biggest flaws are the endlessly repeated reuse of a few small mission template zones, (think Dragon Age 2) and the beefy system requirements. The latter wasn't an issue for me, but will stand in the way of those without a 4000 series GPU, and a strong multi-core CPU. The former is what eventually drove me to uninstall.

By the third or fourth revisit to some of these areas, my team was so well upgraded that the least tedious option was to simply blow through the mission with the grenade launcher, downing multiple enemies in a single shot. The hack-heavy stealth gameplay of the earlier visits melts away to what is essentially nothing more than third-person CoD, with no real reason to stick to the former.

Enemies do scale to progression, but their counter-hacks are easy to shut down, and drone/turret vs drone/turret chaos removes the player from harm so effectively, that you're free to light up the battlefield with little fear of reprisal.

Like most Ubi games of late, Legion suffers from the company's trademark bloat, and could/should have been 20-30 hours shorter. That might have helped with the mission structure, too, as they wouldn't have needed so many revisits to each PoI.

A game I'll likely finish at some point, because the gameloop is incredibly fun, but not one I can stomach in one stretch. Much like AC: Odyssey, and the like.

tldr: much better than at launch, but still an Ubisoft game. Avoid if you're one of the xenophobic tw*ts who voted for Brexit.

review:
This campaign story and open world is far better than the previous iteration. Watch Dogs 2. In my opinion, mainly because it's based in the UK rather than the previous setting of San Francisco Bay. Also the fact that Aiden Pearce is playable in the main campaign. 

The main campaign is fairly okay, not great, but not bad also in terms of game play with hacking puzzles, stealth, and combat. The recruitment system is meh, not something I cared about, but it's unique and alright. I personally didn't like the ending of the campaign. 

What I am excited playing Watch Dogs: Legion DLC for is the backstory of Aiden Pearce. Bloodline.

-------

[h1]Watch Dogs: Legion Bloodline Review[/h1]

Just finished playing the Bloodline DLC. I gotta say it was alright, the boss and the actual main story missions were good. But the filler content aka the free roam missions were crap. They where not necessarily required to do, but they locked behind new guns and basic hacking mechanics thus if not done makes the campaign mission a lot harder I would say. It was clearly designed to pad out the story and game play.

I only liked the Wrench side missions out of the others. The one where he interacts with Jordie Chen and another mystery appearance [spoiler]Mark Ass Brown Lee from Watch Doggies 2[/spoiler]. They where fun to do as the banter between them was fun to listen too. Aiden's side mission on the other hand was complete doo doo in my opinion.

review: 37.5 hours played record, its good game for me enjoying WD series from WD, WD2, and then WD Legion. Worth to play on discount. but still there some kind of bug around the game. like invinsible npc, flying npc, and sometimes you got stuck when you r about to open the map, floating character when you jump to takedown npc, or no fallin damage when u jump from high building when u walk it near the wall. but overall its still worth to try and play it (but its only my opinion, idk hbu guys playing this game)

review: 全程下来没有任何惊喜，标准的流水线剧情，没什么起伏，也没有被游戏烦到或者是不想玩的心情。但是游戏很流畅我是说任务很流畅传送点很多做任务很快10小时左右体验完主线和杂七杂八的。但是但是他很卡，时不时卡一下卡一下的，最后我发现吧手柄拔了就不卡顿了。我喜欢狗1的剧情，狗2的嘻哈风和爽爽的画质，狗3平平无奇，真的平平无奇，军团系统确实不错但是就是觉得差点意思，说不上来。之前我在27寸显示器玩过一遍狗3觉得画质好不自在不清楚，现在steam上架了补票在65寸显示器上4K拉满又觉得狗3画质还是很能打很能打的总之不弱就是了。原价不值得，打折很值得体验一下，虽然平平无奇。

review:
2020 de çıkan Legion, 2014 WD 1'den daha kötü. 
     •Arabaların ağırlığı, WD 1 de olduğu gibi halen yok, park halindeki araca ufak bi dokundurursanız 20m ileri gittiklerini göreceksiniz çünkü neredeyse hiçbir aracın el freni çekilmemiş, drift mekaniğinin gelmesi çok geliştiği algısını uyandırmasın yani.
    •Karakterler... çok... çirkin... mahalle kekosu, teyzem yaşında kadın rapçi gibi giyiniyor. karga suratlı, pembe saçlı, cono çingenesinin komünist bıyığı var, KIYAFETLER TEK BEDEN!!! kafası küçük birine şapka taktığında 2 parmak boşluk kalıyor ve kıyafetlerde çok çirkin. Hiç bir karakterin sesi, tipiyle uyuşmuyor. kadından erkek erkekden kadın sesi gibi uyumsuzluklar var
    • Hikaye daha ilk saatte kendini ele veriyor bi grup şımarık velet dünyayı değiştirmeye çok hevesli falan.(klasik hollywood efekt)
    •wd 1 de tırmanma akıcıydı, bunda karakter nereye tırmanacağını şaşırıyor, aslında şaşırmıyor ama biraz hızlı oynayınca kontrollerin ne kadar gecikmeli olduğunu anlarsınız.
Siper alması için C tuşuna basıyorsunuz ama karakter tam olarak siper almıyor, sırtı kafası falan gözüküyor. WD 1 karakter baya saklanırcasına siper alıyordu.
    • Vuruş hissine önem verenlerdenim ve oyunda vuruş hissi yok hatta direkt olarak WD 1'den kopyala yapıştır yaparak geçiştirmişler. polisin zırhlı araçlarına binmenize rağmen kimseden tık yok. npc'ler kesinlikle WD 1'de daha iyiydi.

Aldığıma pişman oldum, bikaç saat daha oynar silerim. Ubisoft'ta Cyberpunk2077 pastasından kendi payını bu oyunla almış oldu.

review: A great game that surprised me, positively, in many ways. Even though its buggy and crashed more than a few times (in spite of having a good PC), it kept me captivated, attached to some characters and pushed me to play that one more quest, recruit that one more DeadSec operative before going to sleep. Well done, still a fan of the series, awaiting the sequel.

review:
This game feels lost. It's playable but the movement is clunky, the abilities/hacks system is completely different. They also mixed it with Assassins Creed, I personally don't like it.

Watch_Dogs was great, Watch_Dogs 2 was also great and it builds on the initial game. This game feels completely different in a bad way, it completely lost the plot in relation to the first 2 games.

review:
At 36 hours in, I finally give up. I could do a thorough review and discuss in detail the music (which is absolute shit btw -- not one song or artist do I recognize except a few classical pieces) or talk about the story (which is so thin it actually feels like a MacGuffin) or the graphical fidelity, but no. I'm not going to. I'm not wasting another second on this massive pile of bugs beyond depicting my experience just trying to play the game and justify why I say, avoid it lol

Every night I try to play this game, it's crash after crash after crash until eventually I get a good run in where the game seems to be stable. Tonight, I've had 3 crashes in less than an hour (two on one mission, a mission that has crashed yesterday evening too -- all in random spots at random points). For a AAA game studio I cannot believe just how shitty of a job was done on the QA and testing. I fucking give up; I'm done. It's a shame because the damn game is over 100GB! So I'd say I'd try the game again, MAYBE, at some point in the future but at a 100+GB download, I somehow doubt that. I'm just glad I bought this one a massive discount.

Destroying a riot drone crashes the game consistently.
There is a mission that requires destroying riot drones.

Beyond the fact the game was literally incompleteable to me, the recruitment system had a few neat moments and uses but quickly became obviously easy to game and ended up restricting playstyle compared to previous games rather than adding to the game.

It's alright and polished as you'd expect from a AAA but I've already played Assassins Creed, Cyberpunk and GTA so I feel like I'm wasting my time here. While I guess its somewhat fun to mix all those games together I'n not really entranced by the end result. While scanning a mission prior to running it and hacking stuff can be kinda fun (outside of it being awkward to find useful cameras) it also feels like a waste of time when its trivial and considerably quicker to just walk in and shoot people instead.  
I stopped playing when I hit some side quest where I solved a bunch of "look around and match the symbols" puzzles only for the game to then decide to distribute weird glowing things around the same area I just spent ages walking around in expecting me to walk back in there again and go pick them all up. Idk, I just don't really feel like the game designers had the tits to build upon any existing experience and lost the fun somewhere in favour of mindless content.  
I got the game in a sale so I'm not too miffed as its fine content for the bucks but it just strikes me as a little unimaginative. 

I thought the story in Cyberpunk 2077 was way more compelling and the combat way more fun. But if you've already played all of the best of breeds (Red Dead Redemption 2, Witcher III, Cyberpunk, etc) and you're hungry for more sandboxy type games then its worth a whirl if you can pick it up in a sale. But I don't think studios like CDPR (who I would consider best of breed these days) really have much to worry about from this studio.
raw_json:
{"recommendationid": "134784602", "author": {"steamid": "76561197997052107", "num_games_owned": 0, "num_reviews": 14, "playtime_forever": 1069, "playtime_last_two_weeks": 0, "playtime_at_review": 1069, "last_played": 1679013921}, "language": "english", "review": "It's alright and polished as you'd expect from a AAA but I've already played Assassins Creed, Cyberpunk and GTA so I feel like I'm wasting my time here. While I guess its somewhat fun to mix all those games together I'n not really entranced by the end result. While scanning a mission prior to running it and hacking stuff can be kinda fun (outside of it being awkward to find useful cameras) it also feels like a waste of time when its trivial and considerably quicker to just walk in and shoot people instead.  
I stopped playing when I hit some side quest where I solved a bunch of "look around and match the symbols" puzzles only for the game to then decide to distribute weird glowing things around the same area I just spent ages walking around in expecting me to walk back in there again and go pick them all up. Idk, I just don't really feel like the game designers had the tits to build upon any existing experience and lost the fun somewhere in favour of mindless content.  
I got the game in a sale so I'm not too miffed as its fine content for the bucks but it just strikes me as a little unimaginative. 

I thought the story in Cyberpunk 2077 was way more compelling and the combat way more fun. But if you've already played all of the best of breeds (Red Dead Redemption 2, Witcher III, Cyberpunk, etc) and you're hungry for more sandboxy type games then its worth a whirl if you can pick it up in a sale. But I don't think studios like CDPR (who I would consider best of breed these days) really have much to worry about from this studio.", "timestamp_created": 1679014525, "timestamp_updated": 1679014760, "voted_up": false, "votes_up": 2, "votes_funny": 0, "weighted_vote_score": "0.530516445636749268", "comment_count": 0, "steam_purchase": true, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

review:
I've craved for Watch Dogs: Legion to come to Steam, and finally it does! However, it's not all sunshine and rainbows as I thought it is, thanks Ubisoft.

The system of being able to recruit anyone you want to sounds amazing on paper, but it also means that there's no real protagonist in the game. I LOVE the idea but the execution is far from perfect.

The story is mediocre at best. The PLOT started out strong with the mystery of the bombings, but the climax is quite disappointing to say the least. You are also not given many choice, as the only choice you get(from the main story questline) is to kill or save Skye Larson, and whatever choice you make, it will end the same way with the difference being that Skye is alive or dead, she is however, not important at all, so there's really no risk.

There is also an attempted bossfight, in which you are tasked to confront Nigel Cass. This bossfight is rather, anticlimactic. Since all you do is wiring to expose his weak spots and gun his mech down. His second phase however, is even MORE anticlimactic. He exited his now broken mech and decided to attack you face-to-face, his only utility is a semi-invisible cloak that barely even helps him, and you can just shoot him multiple times when he's invisible until he's dead. This is also the only bossfight in the entire game.

I had a good time playing this game, the graphics are beautiful, the city is well crafted. But the same problem in every Ubisoft game is still present, repetition. I can't count just how many areas I've liberated and collectibles I've collected, it started to feel mundane. Lastly, they downgraded hacking to the very VERY basic, really leaves a bad taste in my mouth, but I guess it's for the best.

TLDR; Watch Dogs: Legion is more of a niche game for Watch Dogs fans, which included myself. If you wanted a Watch Dogs game with better STORY and better HACKING, Watch Dogs and Watch Dogs 2 will suffice more.

review:
Not that good, but the girls look good in their underwear :)


The problem isn't even really with the game play, it is fun. I would use my drone to get into enemy camps and then stay up above them, drop my spider on it, then send it down to pick them off with stealth. Although, I did this over and over, I still had fun with it for hours. The story is really REALLY bad. For an unbisoft game though, this was a let down. Far Cry 6 was also a let down as well. Neither are bad games, the problem is - every game before them is so much better the farther you go backwards. That's not a good sign.

review:
It was a really fun experience.

If you are looking for a fun game, then this is for you. But, if you are looking for a heavy hitter in terms of story line, it's definitely not. The you can play as everyone mechanic is cool and unique, but it makes me the story feels less personal. The only sad scene was when we need to kill Bagley, but then he just appears again. Also, even though we have "liberated" London, destroying Clan Kelley, Albion, etc etc. There's no difference to the world. I think, it'd be better if after we finish the story we get to see a clean London. London free form all of the corruption and terror.

review:
POSITIVO: Gráficos, creo que son bastante buenos para la época a la cual fue lanzado, desconozco las versiones de consola, así que no se que tan mejores son los de pc. Ambientación de la ciudad excelente, te sentís en todo momento estar en Londres. El hecho de ir reclutando personas para completar tu aventura me parece una idea buena dentro de lo que cabe. Variedad de armas normal, ni muchas ni pocas. El sonido tanto de los autos como de las armas creo que cumple de sobra. Las habilidades y la forma de obtener puntos de tecnología me parece buena, y las mejores impactan un poco en el desarrollo del juego. Abordando solo misiones primarias el juego dura entre 20 y 30 horas de acuerdo a tu metodología de juego. Forma de "revelar" los barrios interesante, te engancha a querer seguir liberando territorio mas allá de que la recompensa no sea gran cosa. Gran cantidad de items cosméticos. Gran cantidad de coleccionables por toda la ciudad. Minijuegos algo interesantes. Drones, muchísima variedad con diferentes propósitos, la verdad un punto interesante para conservar en el futuro. Peleas finales contra dos enemigos realmente interesante que escapa de la normalidad de Ubisoft. Mapa muy interactivo y fácil de entender. Dificultad adaptada para todos los tipos de jugadores. El robot araña creo que esta muy bien implementado pero cuando lo aprendes a usar se convierte casi en un tanque de guerra invencible.

NEGATIVO: Historia, la peor de 3 Watch Dogs, realmente no interesa mucho seguir el hilo, es un total cliche. Optimizacion, NEFASTA, con una pc gama media/alta del 2023 me fue totalmente imposible llega a 60 FPS, iba a un máximo de 40, y la mayoría de las cinemáticas estaban capadas a 30, una burla para todos los jugadores de PC. IA, la IA de los enemigos realmente es típica de un juego de Ubisoft, no podemos pedir grandes cosas, el problema es la IA de los conductores, creo que nunca he visto algo tan patético, los conductores viven teniendo accidentes y bloqueando las carreteras, un comportamiento deplorable. Mas allá que puse como algo positivo el hecho de reclutar gente, me parece algo negativo poder reclutar a cualquier persona del mundo, en síntesis todo el mundo tiene habilidades de hackeo, jóvenes, viejos, es todo igual, cambian solo ciertos atributos. Misiones secundarias que ni son interesantes ni aportan algo nuevo al juego, son la mayoría de infiltración para no lograr absolutamente nada. Misiones para reclutar gente nueva repetitivas hasta el hartazgo. Hackeos, si bien hay un amplio abanico de posibilidades, son menos interesantes que los de Watch Dogs 2.

EN RESUMEN: Un juego que recomiendo comprar solo si lo adquirís realmente muy barato, empeora todo lo bueno que tenia Watch Dogs 2. Los que sean fanáticos de esta saga no esperen algo interesante.

review: Рекомендую чисто из за того, что играть хоть и немного, но приятно. А так, начало игры через чур клише, так и сделано так, будто его анимировали команда из 5 неопытных человек на движке юнити. Конкретнее, начало очень скучное, немного пройдя дальше, желание играть в компанию оборвалось полностью. мультиплеер, единственное место, где я еще возможно буду играть. Только поэтому я поставлю РЕКОМЕНДУЮ, учитывая за какие копейки я купил игру.

review:
这个游戏在不碰开放世界的情况下还是可以玩的。

这个收集成员的概念很酷，可惜游戏没有很好的实现，很多角色的能力没啥用，而且玩家成长树也不是很大，基本没有那种改变玩法的成长，第一关我在用无人机潜入，最后一关我还在用无人机潜入，支线一点没碰，全程都是货运机器人飞天上然后无人机潜入。

review: Я привык к дрочильням от Юбисофт и думал что готов к этой, ожидая что то с управлением 2 ватч догса и лучшей графикой анимациями итд, но увы не было не того ни другого, запустил сразу длс с Эйденом Пирсом но даже это не помогло мне находится в этой игре. Она очень плохо выглядит с точки зрения визуала, играется будто бы что то с мобильного рынка и отдельного упоминания стоит бег - ужасней анимации в играх которые метят в AAA я не видел, жду возврат средств. Порекомендовать это могу только в том случае если хочется купить первую часть со всеми DLC (она тут идёт в комплекте в Gold Edition)  и только по скидке минимум -80%

review:
Este juego utiliza el mismo Engine del AC? Parece como si jugaras al AC 1. Creo que lo que se intento hacer es modificar el Engine por el del AC, para en proximas ediciones presentar algo parecido a lo visto en valhalla (espero... porque de no ser así, dudo de seguir comprando esta serie).
Muchos bugs, mucho descuido, poca mecanica, todo raro. La historia no la termine y esta safable, pero lo que no safa es todo lo demas.
